0.title: Pune provided 14 more slots for civil flights per day, says Scindia
0.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Friday that Defence Ministry has provided 14 additional slots for civil flight operations per day from Pune Airport. "Monday to Saturday slots have increased from 102 to 116 while...Sunday slots have increased from 131 to 145," he added. Furthermore, he said that Pune will soon get direct air connectivity with Singapore.

1.title: BJP's Nishikant Dubey, Manoj Tiwari booked for forced entry into ATC in Deoghar
1.article_body: BJP MPs Nishikant Dubey and Manoj Tiwari were among nine people booked for allegedly forcing their way into the Air Traffic Control (ATC) at Jharkhand's Deoghar airport. They have been accused of pressuring officials to give clearance for flight take-off, which was then provided. Dubey's two sons and Deoghar airport director have also been named in the FIR.

2.title: 5 JD(U) MLAs join BJP in Manipur weeks after party broke ties with BJP in Bihar
2.article_body: As many as five of six Janata Dal (United) MLAs in Manipur joined BJP on Friday, weeks after the party broke ties with BJP in Bihar. "Honourable Speaker of the Manipur Assembly accepted the merger of the five JD(U) MLAs to BJP namely Khumukcham Joykishan Singh, Ngursanglur Sanate, Md Achab Uddin, Thangjam Arunkumar and LM Khoute," BJP's Manipur unit tweeted.

3.title: 'Hold interviews at 11pm, on Sundays to hire people,' says Pristyn Care founder; criticised
3.article_body: Pristyn Care's Co-founder Harsimarbir Singh is facing criticism after he shared a LinkedIn post on "interesting interview hacks" used by the health-tech startup to find "special driven people". In the now-deleted post, Singh shared how Pristyn Care schedules interviews at 11pm and on Sundays to spot "late workers" and test their commitment and makes candidates spend 6-8 hours in office.

4.title: 70-year-old woman dies after falling off 11th floor in Gurugram
4.article_body: A 70-year-old woman died after falling off the 11th floor of a building in Gurugram on Friday. According to police, Rajinder Kaur Sapra had gone to her elder sister's flat in Sector 58 to check on the shifting work and fell from the flat under mysterious circumstances. "A postmortem will be conducted on Saturday," said investigating officer ASI Sanjeev Kumar.

5.title: TV anchor swallows a fly while presenting news on Pakistan floods; video goes viral
5.article_body: Canadian TV anchor Farah Nasser swallowed a fly while presenting news on floods in Pakistan. Sharing a video of the incident, Nasser tweeted, "Sharing because we all need a laugh these days...I swallowed a fly on air today." The video shows that she continued her live segment even after the fly flew straight into her mouth.

6.title: We played 'poor' shots: HK captain on being bowled out for 38 vs Pak
6.article_body: Reacting to his team being bowled out for 38 in their defeat against Pakistan by 155 runs in the Asia Cup, Hong Kong captain Nizakat Khan said, "Our shots...were poor." "Hong Kong scored 152 against India and...Pakistan [are] winning against them by 155 runs. Hari Om," read a reaction on Twitter. Pakistan have now recorded their biggest win in T20Is.

7.title: Theranos Founder's request to overturn her conviction denied in US
7.article_body: A US judge on Thursday upheld the conviction of Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes in a preliminary ruling. Holmes, who was found guilty on four counts of wire fraud and conspiracy related to her now-defunct blood-testing startup, had requested the judge to overturn her verdict, saying there was "insufficient evidence". She faces up to 20 years in prison for each count.

8.title: School uncooperative, victim in trauma: NCPCR on Delhi's sexual assault case
8.article_body: While speaking about the case of sexual assault of a class three student by one of his seniors in the toilet of a school in East Delhi, National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) Chairperson, Priyank Kanoongo, said the school authorities were uncooperative with the probe team. He added that victim is in trauma and is unable to study.

9.title: Completely new COVID strains possible this winter: EU drug agency
9.article_body: Entirely new COVID-19 variants could emerge this winter but existing vaccines will still be able to protect people from serious illness and death, the European Medicines Agency said. This comes as the 27-nation European Union prepares to roll out booster shots ahead of the feared new wave. Reportedly, over 2,300 people across the EU are dying of COVID-19 every week.

10.title: Ranbir inspired me as an actor, 'Rockstar' is my favourite film: Jr NTR
10.article_body: Actor Jr NTR during a press conference for 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' said that one actor he really connects with is Ranbir Kapoor. "'Rockstar' is my favourite film. The intensity he had while performing in Rockstar, really left a mark," the actor added. He further said Ranbir inspired him, adding that his journey doesn't stop with 'Brahmāstra'.

11.title: I am really sorry: Tomljanovic after beating Serena in her last match
11.article_body: Reacting to her 7-5, 6-7(4-7), 6-1 win against Serena Williams in the US Open's third round, Australia's Ajla Tomljanovic said, "I'm...really sorry...[as] I love Serena just as much as you...do." "I just thought Serena would beat me," she added. "I never thought...I'd have a chance to play her in her last match," stated Tomljanovic. Serena broke down after the defeat.

12.title: FM questions Collector over no pic of PM at T'gana fair price shops
12.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday questioned Kamareddy District Collector Jitesh Patil over the absence of PM Narendra Modi's photos at fair price shops. She asked Patil why there was no flex board of the PM as mandated for ration shops that receive rice supplies under the central government's scheme. She asked him to ensure the pictures are displayed.

13.title: BJP governments in UP, Assam are targeting madrassas: Muslim body
13.article_body: All India Muslim Personal Law Board General Secretary Khalid Saifullah Rahmani in a statement said that BJP governments in Uttar Pradesh and Assam "are after the madrassas over very small violations" and are "targeting" them. "If bulldozing buildings is the only option for any violation then why don't they take a similar approach for gurukuls, mutts and dharmshalas," he said.

14.title: POCSO court Judge found dead at Odisha official residence, probe underway
14.article_body: A special POCSO court Judge was found dead in his official residence in Odisha's Cuttack on Friday, police said, adding that it seems to be a case of death by suicide. The incident reportedly took place when the judge's wife and daughter were not at home. He was taken to the hospital and was declared brought dead by doctors.

15.title: SpiceJet to get ₹225 crore under ECLGS next week: Report
15.article_body: Low-cost airline SpiceJet will receive around ₹225 crore next week as part of Emergency Credit Line Guarantee Scheme (ECLGS) programme, ANI quoted sources as saying. The special scheme was launched by the Centre in 2020 amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The fund is intended to provide guarantee coverage to banks and NBFCs, enabling them to extend emergency credit to various industries.

16.title: Zimbabwe create history, win an ODI against Australia in Australia for 1st time ever
16.article_body: Zimbabwe defeated Australia by three wickets in the third ODI in Townsville on Saturday to record their first-ever victory in ODI cricket against Australia on Australian soil. Zimbabwe dismissed Australia for 141 and chased down the target in 39 overs. Prior to this match, Zimbabwe had played 13 ODIs against Australia in Australia, losing 12, while one match produced no-result.

17.title: Ayan Mukerji dreamt of 'Brahmāstra' on 'Yeh Jawaani...' sets: Ranbir
17.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor revealed during a press meet that director Ayan Mukerji dreamt of 'Brahmāstra' on the sets of 2013 film 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani'. "He was dreaming of this idea which was beyond what anyone has done in the Hindi film industry. It was two 26-year-old boys talking [about] movies," the actor added. 'Brahmāstra' also features Alia Bhatt.

18.title: Bayer to settle US whistleblower claims over 3 drugs for $40 mn
18.article_body: German chemical and pharmaceutical major Bayer has agreed to pay $40 million to settle whistleblower claims alleging the use of kickbacks and false statements related to three prescription drugs, the US Department of Justice said. Laurie Simpson, a former Bayer employee, filed lawsuits in 2005 and 2006 in New Jersey accusing the company of violating the federal False Claims Act.

19.title: Nora Fatehi questioned for 7 hours in ₹200-crore extortion case against conman Sukesh
19.article_body: Delhi Police Economic Offences Wing questioned actress-dancer Nora Fatehi in connection with ₹200-crore extortion case against conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. "She came at around 11 am and left the office around 6 pm. She recorded her statement and the police asked her about the gifts presented by Sukesh to her," an officer said. Earlier, she was questioned by the Enforcement Directorate.

20.title: Man named finalist for Austalia's 'Women in Technology' award, sparks criticism
20.article_body: The announcement of a man as a finalist for an award by Women in Technology (WiT) in Australia has sparked criticism. Simon Button, Group CTO of Qscan, has been nominated for 'Inspiring Diversity in STEM' award along with three others, who are all women. "Lol is this a joke," a social media user said, while another wrote, "This is pathetic."

21.title: BJP's Giriraj Singh demands survey of madrasas, mosques in Bihar
21.article_body: BJP leader Giriraj Singh has demanded a survey of madrasas and mosques in Bihar. "We demanded from the Nitish Kumar government to conduct survey of the madrasas and mosques of Bihar, especially in Muslim-dominated Seemanchal region. We must have data about who are running madrasas and mosques in these regions and who are staying in them," Singh said.

22.title: BMC to allow immersion of Ganesha idols at Gateway of India jetty
22.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to make arrangements for immersion of Ganesha idols at the Gateway of India jetty on September 4 and 9. Idol immersion at the jetty was banned in 2019 after a boat got damaged during immersion. The BMC decided to allow immersion at the site owing to increased number of pandals in south Mumbai.

23.title: 4 dead, 14 injured after speeding truck hits bus parked to change punctured tyre in UP
23.article_body: At least four persons died and around 14 were injured after a speeding truck hit a bus in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki on Saturday, police said. The accident took place when the bus, going from Nepal to Goa, was parked to change a punctured tyre. "The bus had around 60 passengers...arrangements being made to send them back to Nepal," police added.

24.title: Kohli trains wearing special high-altitude mask ahead of India-Pak match, pics viral
24.article_body: Pictures and videos of former Team India captain Virat Kohli training wearing a special high-altitude mask ahead of India-Pakistan Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match have gone viral. Kohli was seen running for around 10 minutes wearing the special mask. India and Pakistan will play against each other in the ongoing Asia Cup for the second time on Sunday.

25.title: OnlyFans pays $517 million in dividends to its owner in 2 years
25.article_body: Adult content subscription platform OnlyFans paid its owner Leonid Radvinsky $517 million in dividends in the last two years, the company's accounts revealed. The 40-year-old Ukrainian-American executive is the sole shareholder of OnlyFans' holding company. Notably, OnlyFans posted pre-tax profits of $433 million in the year ended November 30, while its creators made nearly $4 billion in 2021.

26.title: Which are the world's top 5 economies as India overtakes UK?
26.article_body: India has overtaken UK to become the world's fifth largest economy. India is now behind just the US, China, Japan and Germany. A decade ago, India ranked 11th among the largest economies, while the UK was 5th. The UK is facing the fastest inflation in four decades and rising risks of a recession.

27.title: Russia scraps Saturday deadline to resume gas supply to Europe
27.article_body: Russia, which stopped gas supplies through a major pipeline to Europe on Wednesday for maintenance, has scrapped the Saturday deadline to resume deliveries. Gazprom said it couldn't restart supply until an oil leak in a Nord Stream 1 turbine was fixed. However, Siemens Energy, which services Nord Stream 1 turbines, said such a leak shouldn't stop operations of the pipeline.

28.title: Ananya, Shanaya were proud of 'Fabulous Lives...': Bhavana, Maheep
28.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Bhavana Pandey has stated that her daughter Ananya Panday said she is proud of her mother for the show and is very happy about it. Maheep Kapoor said that her daughter Shanaya Kapoor was very supportive and told her to go for it. "My kids said, 'Go, live your dreams mamma'," she added.

29.title: U'khand man beaten to death by in-laws days after marrying upper caste woman
29.article_body: Days after he married an upper caste woman against her family's wishes, a Dalit man was beaten to death by his in-laws in Uttarakhand. Reports said that the man had sought police security before the incident. Police have arrested the woman's mother, stepfather and stepbrother. The couple got married on August 21, police said.

30.title: Ayan Mukerji can't even pronounce 'Brahmāstra': Vivek Agnihotri
30.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri in an interview spoke about Ayan Mukerji directorial 'Brahmāstra', saying that the latter can't even pronounce Brahmastra. "Do they even know the meaning of that? And then they are talking about Astra Verse, what is even that?" Vivek added. The filmmaker further said he is concerned about Ayan like a mother, adding that he is very disappointed.

31.title: Everything essential to people seems 'revdi' to central govt: Baghel
31.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel alleged that "everything essential to common people seems to be a 'revdi' (freebies) to the central government". "That is the reason they have shut down over 1000 trains in...past few months, which was the cheapest mode of transportation," Baghel added. Notably, 58 trains originating or passing through Chhattisgarh were cancelled by the Railways last week.

32.title: T Raja Singh moved within Hyderabad jail amid security concerns
32.article_body: Suspended BJP leader T Raja Singh was moved from the Manasa barrack to the Shraddha barrack within Cherlapalli jail in Hyderabad amid a possible security threat from ISIS sympathisers in the facility. The decision was taken based on inputs from the intelligence department. Singh was jailed under Preventive Detention (PD) Act after being accused of insulting Prophet Muhammad.

33.title: 1997 Uphaar Tragedy victims move HC against grant of relief to Ansals
33.article_body: Association of the Victims of Uphaar Tragedy has moved the Delhi High Court against the grant of relief to Sushil Ansal and Gopal Ansal. This comes after a lower court's decision to release the Ansal brothers after they spent eight months and 12 days in jail. They were accused of tampering with evidence in the 1997 Uphaar cinema fire case.

34.title: 8 Colombian police officers killed following President's push for peace
34.article_body: Eight police officers have been killed in an explosives attack in Colombia, President Gustavo Petro said. It is the worst attack on security forces since Petro was sworn in as Colombia's first left-wing President less than a month ago, promising to end the country's nearly 60-year conflict. Petro condemned the attack, calling it "a clear act of sabotage against peace".

35.title: Incorrect to suggest otherwise: TCS on reports of no pay hike for experienced staff
35.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) responded after media reports claimed that the IT major has revised its anniversary appraisal policy and will not be rolling out hikes to employees who have completed one year. TCS said, "It's incorrect to suggest otherwise. All experienced hires will be given an increase as part of the annual salary appraisal that follows their one-year anniversary."

36.title: India reports 7,219 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 56,745
36.article_body: India has reported 7,219 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 6,168 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 56,745, while the death toll has risen to 5,27,965, according to the latest data.

37.title: Kavita Krishnan resigns from all CPIML Liberation posts
37.article_body: Kavita Krishnan has resigned from all CPI (Marxist-Leninist) Liberation posts stating she needed to pursue "certain troubling political questions". "The need to recognise...it's not enough to discuss Stalin regime, USSR...as failed socialisms but as some of the world's worst authoritarianism(s) that serve as a model for authoritarian regimes everywhere," Krishnan listed as one of the questions.

38.title: Actress Jane Fonda diagnosed with cancer, says 'Cancer is a teacher'
38.article_body: Actress Jane Fonda has revealed she has been diagnosed with non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, adding that she has started chemotherapy treatment. "Cancer is a teacher and I'm paying attention to the lessons it holds for me...And the cancer, along with my age --almost 85-- definitely teaches the importance of adapting to new realities," the Oscar-winning actress wrote in a post on Instagram.

39.title: Amitabh Bachchan asks question about Anup Soni in KBC 14; actor reacts
39.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan asked a question about actor Anup Soni's role as 'Crime Patrol' show host on a recent episode of KBC 14. Reacting to this, Soni tweeted, "It's always a high to hear Mr Bachchan take your name in his legendary voice! 'ANUP SONI CRIME PATROL KE HOST REH CHUKE HAIN'...KBC mein ek sawaal mujh par bhi."

40.title: How much prize money and how many titles did Serena win in her career that ended today?
40.article_body: Serena Williams, who played the last match of her career today, won 73 singles and 23 doubles titles in her 27-year tennis career. She won 23 Grand Slam singles titles, including seven Australian Open, three French Open, seven Wimbledon and six US Open titles. She won 14 Grand Slam doubles titles. She won a total prize money of $94,816,730.

41.title: Argentinians rally for Vice Prez Cristina after assassination attempt
41.article_body: Hundreds of thousands of Argentinians took to the streets on Friday to condemn political violence and show support for Vice President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner, who survived an assassination attempt outside her home. The supporters were heard chanting, "We are all Cristina". The 69-year-old escaped unharmed on Thursday evening after a gunman's weapon jammed as he aimed at her.

42.title: HC refuses to grant stay on BBMP ward delimitation process
42.article_body: The Karnataka High Court refused to stay the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) ward delimitation process. The order came after the State Election Commission told the court that the final list of voters would be published on September 22, only after which the election process would begin. The court said the petitions challenging delimitation could be disposed of by then.

43.title: 4.4-magnitude earthquake hits Andaman and Nicobar Islands, 2nd in 24 hours
43.article_body: A 4.4-magnitude earthquake hit the Andaman and Nicobar Islands at around 6.59 am today, the National Center for Seismology reported. This was the second earthquake to strike the islands in last 24 hours. The earthquake occurred 106 km east-north-east of Port Blair. No casualties or damages have been reported by the authorities so far.

44.title: Man takes video of woman bathing, blackmails her in Ghaziabad; held
44.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have arrested a 32-year-old man who allegedly secretly recorded a video of a 28-year-old woman while she took a bath and then used it to blackmail her. The woman claimed that the accused also demanded that she pay him ₹1 lakh. According to the police, the woman and accused used to be neighbours and shared a common bathroom.

45.title: Delhi Police to get 30 hi-tech mobile labs for forensic investigation
45.article_body: The Delhi Police will procure 30 mobile vans, equipped with all essentials that are needed for minute examinations and preservation of exhibits, for forensic investigation. According to police sources, each van will have at least 14 basic investigation kits required for biological forensics, gunshot residues and narcotics. The cost of each van will be around ₹50 lakh, they added.

46.title: I told Rajamouli that RRR is like a circus for me, was something exotic: RGV
46.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said that he told filmmaker SS Rajamouli that he found 'RRR' to be like a circus. "I don't mean it in a bad way. The circus usually reminds us of clowns...[When] Ram Charan and Jr NTR rescue boy...[it] reminded me of junglee circus as it involves people holding ropes and swinging...it was something exotic," he added.

47.title: J&K Congress leader Rajinder Prasad resigns from all party posts
47.article_body: After veteran leader Ghulam Nabi Azad, J&K Congress leader Rajinder Prasad resigned from all party posts. "The party is today surrounded by a coterie of yes men and parachuters. As a result, they are ignorant of the general public's reality and sorrows, which leads to this big old party's demise," Prasad wrote in his resignation letter.

48.title: Woman kills self; man booked for rape, abetment to suicide in Pune
48.article_body: The police have filed a case against a man in Pune after a 32-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide after the man developed physical relations with her but then refused to marry her. The accused and the woman had met on an online marriage portal. The police have booked the accused on charges of rape, cheating and abetment to suicide.

49.title: I don't pay attention: Nitish Kumar on PM Modi's 'polarisation' remark
49.article_body: Commenting on PM Narendra Modi's "new polarisation in national politics" remarks, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said that he "doesn't pay attention to what central leaders are saying". PM Modi had said that action against corrupt people had led to a new polarisation in national politics. "Nobody is shielding the corrupt," Nitish Kumar said while talking to journalists.

50.title: 2 of family, including 13-year-old girl, drown in Pune's Pavana Dam
50.article_body: At least two members of a family, including a 13-year-old girl, drowned in Pune's Pavana Dam and five others were rescued on Friday afternoon, police said. The victims had come to the Pavana Dam from Mumbai for a picnic, police added. The incident took place when they were enjoying the dam water at Fangne village.

51.title: Thane Police not safe, 54 cases of attacks on duty reported in 6 months: Data
51.article_body: Data by the Thane Police Commissionerate said that the Thane Police is not safe while on duty. The data said that 54 such cases have been reported in six months of 2022 alone. Meanwhile, as per data, 94 such cases had been recorded in 2021. Advocate Sachin Kulkarni said that attacks on police officers are "very common".

52.title: 35-yr-old woman dies after stone crashes into her house in Thane
52.article_body: A 35-year-old woman died on the spot when a huge stone from a hill crashed into her house in Thane's Mumbra town on Friday. According to Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) chief Avinash Sawant, the incident occurred at around 5.20 pm in Gavdevi locality of the town. Following the incident, 14 tenements in the locality were vacated, Sawant added.

53.title: US approves potential $1.1 bn arms sale to Taiwan; China opposes
53.article_body: The US State Department has approved a potential $1.1 billion arms sale to Taiwan. The arms package includes $355 million for Harpoon air-to-sea missiles and $85 million for Sidewinder air-to-air missiles and aims to boost Taiwan's defence capabilities, the State Department said. China opposed the move and said the arms sale "severely jeopardises China-US relations" and it'll take countermeasures.

54.title: India overtakes UK to become world’s fifth largest economy: Bloomberg
54.article_body: As per a report by Bloomberg, India overtook UK to become the world's fifth largest economy. India leaped past the UK in the final three months of 2021, the report added. The size of the Indian economy in "nominal" cash terms grew to $854.7 billion, while that of UK was $816 billion, the report stated.

55.title: MANUU in Hyderabad to honour 'Stars of Urdu' on Teachers' Day
55.article_body: Maulana Azad National Urdu University (MANUU) in Hyderabad will hold an event on Teachers' Day (September 5) to honour people who made significant contributions in promoting the Urdu language across communities. They will be recognised as 'Sitara-e-Urdu' or the 'Stars of Urdu'. Among those to be felicitated include Lakshmi Devi Raj, Syed Jafar Amir Rizvi and Shahid Husain Zuberi.

56.title: Saving and investing higher priorities than spending right now: Jupiter
56.article_body: Even amongst our highest and most frequent spenders, we see a sudden increase in use of Tag Spends, Save in Pots, and No-Penalty SIP for investments said Jupiter, a 100% digital banking and investing app. Users are tracking expenses with Custom Tags and Categories and are prioritizing saving and investing more towards their goals, more than ever before, added Jupiter.

57.title: Go back to India, you're a parasite invader: Man in Poland to Indian man in viral video
57.article_body: A video showing a man racially abusing an Indian man in Poland is going viral on social media. Calling the Indian man a "parasite invader", he could be heard saying, "Why don't you go back to India...Why are your people invading our homelands...Why are you coming to the white man's land...You're genociding our race." The white man was reportedly American.

58.title: Tata Hospital recreated at Dombivli Ganesh pandal to demand similar facility
58.article_body: Residents of a society in Dombivli have made a replica of the Tata Memorial Hospital at a Ganesh pandal. Reports said that it has been made to demand a similar facility in Kalyan-Dombivli. "It's a big struggle to reach the hospital in Mumbai or Kharghar," a resident who was diagnosed with breast cancer in May, said.

59.title: Serena breaks down after losing in US Open in last match of her career, video viral
59.article_body: Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams broke down during interview after losing in US Open 2022 third round in what was the last match of her career. The 40-year-old lost to Australia's Ajla Tomljanović 5-7, 7-6(7-4), 1-6. "Thank you daddy...I know you're watching. Thanks mom...It all started with my parents and they deserve everything...These are happy tears," she said.

60.title: UP jail's food gets 5-star rating by govt body; pic of certificate goes viral
60.article_body: The food served to the over 1,100 inmates lodged in the district jail in Fatehgarh in UP's Farrukhabad has received a 5-star rating from the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI). "District Jail Fatehgarh, Farrukhabad is certified as Eat Right CAMPUS as per guidelines established by the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India," the certificate read.

61.title: Former Sri Lanka Prez Rajapaksa who escaped to Singapore during protests returns
61.article_body: Sri Lanka's ousted President Gotabaya Rajapaksa returned home on Saturday after fleeing the country in July during protests amid the economic crisis. Rajapaksa had resigned after protesters stormed his office and residence. He had fled to Singapore via the Maldives and then spent a few weeks in Thailand.

62.title: Bengaluru reports 775 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
62.article_body: Bengaluru reported 775 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,65,722 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Friday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,983. The number of active cases was 3,450, while the infection positivity rate stood at 3.95%.

63.title: HC asks Delhi Police chief to ensure adequate force for demolition
63.article_body: Delhi High Court has directed the Delhi Commissioner of Police to ensure that adequate force is provided during an upcoming demolition drive in the Sunder Nagri area of the national capital. This comes after the standing counsel for MCD told the court that adequate police force was not provided for the demolition drive against unauthorised construction.

64.title: Former champion Andy Murray crashes out of US Open 2022 in 3rd round
64.article_body: Former world number one Andy Murray crashed out of the US Open 2022 in the third round after losing to Matteo Berrettini. The 35-year-old, who had won the Grand Slam in New York in 2012, lost with a scoreline of 4-6, 4-6, 7-6(7-1), 3-6. Murray had last won a Grand Slam in 2016, when he clinched the Wimbledon.

65.title: Have sought time with Prez Murmu to discuss Operation Lotus: AAP
65.article_body: A delegation of AAP leaders has sought an appointment with President Droupadi Murmu to complain against BJP's alleged 'Operation Lotus'. "The BJP has bought a whopping 277 MLAs...to topple governments in various states," said MLA Atishi, adding that the BJP tried to buy 40 AAP MLAs. Atishi later claimed that the President had agreed to meet them on September 7.

66.title: 3 splinter terror groups present in J&K's Rajouri, Poonch: Police
66.article_body: DIG Police of Rajouri-Poonch range in Kashmir, Haseeb Mughal, said there are three splinter terror groups present in the border districts and security forces are working to neutralise them. He said the terror groups are on the radar of security agencies and they are taking advantage of the monsoon. He added that local support for these terrorists is "almost negligible".

67.title: Won't sell dreams that India will play WC in 8 years: New AIFF President
67.article_body: AIFF's new President Kalyan Chaubey said he will not "sell dreams" like the one that India will play in the World Cup in eight years. "We will take Indian football forward from the current condition...we will take help from each and every individual," said Chaubey. The BJP leader said FIFA informed him that it wants to work with India.

68.title: Adopt 1 TB patient for a year for PM Modi's birthday: BJP to leaders
68.article_body: The BJP will be organising multiple events from September 17 to October 2 for PM Narendra Modi's birthday. Other than district-level exhibitions, the party has also asked its leaders to adopt one TB patient for a year. The BJP has further asked its leaders to ensure beneficiaries at every mandal send a 'Shubhakamna Patra' (Best wishes letter) to the PM.

69.title: Delhi records 299 fresh COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths
69.article_body: Delhi reported 299 new cases of COVID-19 on Friday along with two fatalities due to the infection, the city health department said. A daily positivity rate of 2.17% was recorded in the national capital, as per the health department. The city's active caseload stood at 1,457. Delhi on Thursday had logged 271 COVID-19 cases and three deaths.

70.title: 8 clubs, including PSG, AC Milan, agree to pay fines worth $172.50 million
70.article_body: Paris St Germain, AC Milan, Juventus and Inter Milan are among eight clubs who have agreed to pay fines worth $172.50 million after failing to comply with break-even requirements last season. Among the eight, PSG are liable for the biggest fine of around $65 million, UEFA said. Almost $26 million of the total penalty amount will be paid in full.

71.title: Not coal scam, it's Home Minister scam: TMC's Abhishek amid ED probe
71.article_body: TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee, who's being interrogated by the ED in an alleged coal scam, said on Friday, "This is not a coal scam or cattle scam, this is Home Minister [Amit Shah] scam." He asked, "How is coal or cattle smuggling happening without...assistance from the central government?" The money from cow trafficking has directly gone to Shah, he alleged.

72.title: Chhattisgarh will soon see ED, I-T raids for housing Jharkhand MLAs: Baghel
72.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Friday said his state will soon witness Enforcement Directorate (ED) and Income Tax (I-T) department raids as MLAs of ruling coalition from Jharkhand are staying in a resort near Raipur. "The BJP doesn't have faith in democracy," Baghel said. "Jharkhand MLAs are staying in Raipur and we've welcomed them...BJP is protesting against it," Baghel added.

73.title: When public interest is urgent, private interest must give way: SC
73.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday said when public interest is clearly articulated, urgent and a pressing exigency, private interests must make way. The court made the observations in a case where private individuals with a land title resisted construction of a road proposed to go through their property. The proposed road moves from Mahakali Caves to Central MIDC in Mumbai.

74.title: Odisha man gets life imprisonment for killing wife over dowry
74.article_body: A court in Odisha's Ganjam district on Friday awarded life imprisonment to a man for setting his wife on fire and killing her over dowry in 2016. A fine of ₹10,000 was also imposed on him. The verdict in the case was pronounced on the basis of statements by 20 witnesses, medical report and the dying declaration, the prosecution said.

75.title: Dawood Ibrahim's brother Iqbal hospitalised for open heart surgery
75.article_body: Fugitive underworld don Dawood Ibrahim's brother Iqbal Kaskar was admitted to Mumbai's JJ Hospital for open heart surgery on Friday. His condition is stable, hospital authorities said. Iqbal had complained about chest pains earlier. Iqbal, who was arrested by the Thane Police in 2017, is currently lodged in Thane Central Jail in connection with a money laundering case.

76.title: G7 finance ministers agree on price cap on Russian oil
76.article_body: G7 finance ministers on Friday said they have agreed to implement a price cap on Russian oil to impede Moscow from attaining its objectives in its invasion of Ukraine. The G7 ministers attended a summit in Elmau, Germany. US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said the price cap will deliver a blow to Russian finances and hinder its operations in Ukraine.

77.title: Big blow for England: Bhogle on Bairstow being ruled out of T20 WC 2022
77.article_body: After England wicketkeeper-batter Jonny Bairstow was ruled out of the third Test against South Africa and T20 World Cup 2022 following a lower limb injury on Friday, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Got to feel for Bairstow." He added, "Freak accident that could happen to anyone, anytime. Big blow for England. Bairstow could have been a game-changer at...T20 World Cup."

78.title: FIR filed in UP's Hamirpur after man claims wife abducted, raped
78.article_body: An FIR has been registered in UP's Hamirpur district on the basis of a man's complaint alleging that his wife was kept in captivity for seven days and raped, police said on Friday. The complainant has accused a woman from his neighbourhood of being complicit in the alleged crime. The victim was found on August 29, her husband has claimed.

79.title: 2,800 gelatin sticks for illegal quarrying seized in Assam, 1 arrested
79.article_body: Assam Police seized a "huge cache of explosives", including 2,800 gelatin sticks and 1,500 electronic detonators, in Kamrup district on Friday, officials said. The explosives were found in a pick-up van in the Rani area and its driver was arrested. Police said the explosives would have been used for illegal quarrying.

80.title: New strain of monkeypox detected in UK
80.article_body: A new strain of monkeypox has been identified in the UK, officials said. The strain, whose preliminary genomic sequencing showed it is different from the current strain circulating in the UK, was found in an individual who had recently returned from West Africa. The individual was admitted to the High Consequence Infectious Disease (HCID) unit of Royal Liverpool University Hospital.

81.title: Palestinian man stabs Israeli soldier, gunned down
81.article_body: A Palestinian man was shot at after he stabbed an Israeli soldier at a military outpost near the city of Hebron in West Bank on Friday, the Israeli army said. The assailant was gunned down by another soldier, the army added. The alleged assailant succumbed to the bullet wound he sustained during the incident, the Palestinian Authority confirmed.

82.title: No homework till Class 2, school bags weight to be monitored: MP govt
82.article_body: Madhya Pradesh School Education Department issued guidelines on Friday stating students up to Class 2 from all government and private schools in the state will not be given homework. It directed the schools to ensure students carry school bags of weights as prescribed by the department. Schools should also call students without bags at least once a week, it added.

83.title: Hasbulla challenges McGregor to UFC fight after 'smelly inbred' comment
83.article_body: MMA fighter Conor McGregor called Hasbulla Magomedov a "little smelly inbred" and said he would "boot" the internet star "over a goal post". McGregor said it was his "mission to score a 3-pointer with" Hasbulla. Hasbulla responded by challenging McGregor to a UFC fight and said the former champion was looking for attention as he has run out of money.

84.title: In top 3, you need such a batter who provides stability: Saba on Kohli
84.article_body: Speaking about India batter Virat Kohli's approach in T20Is following his 59*(44) against Hong Kong at Asia Cup, Saba Karim stated the 33-year-old has always been such a batter in T20Is who accelerates incredibly well after facing 15-20 balls. "In...top three, you need such a batter who provides stability to the team and Kohli is doing exactly that," he added.

85.title: Ready to fight KSI, True Geordie on the same night: Andrew Tate
85.article_body: Former kickboxer and internet personality Andrew Tate said he is ready to fight British YouTubers KSI and True Geordie on the same night. "Make that for a YouTube boxing show. I will beat both of them," said Tate, responding to Geordie's comment that he would punch Andrew if they came face-to-face. Earlier, KSI said he wanted "a piece of" Tate.

86.title: Pehle party toh jod lo: Nadda on Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
86.article_body: Reacting to Congress' upcoming 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', BJP chief JP Nadda said on Friday, "They are talking of 'Bharat Jodo, Bharat Jodo', arrey pehle party toh jod lo (unite the party first)." Nadda claimed that senior leaders are quitting the Congress with a message that the party needs to keep its flock together. He called the Congress a "brother-sister party".

87.title: Occultist arrested for raping 3 women in UP's Gorakhpur
87.article_body: An occultist was arrested for allegedly raping three women in a village in Gorakhpur, UP. The occultist, Shyambihari, used to call the three victims under a peepal tree in the village at 12 am on different nights before intoxicating and raping them, police said. The accused also took money from them in the name of supernatural treatment, police added.

88.title: India to face Pakistan on Sunday as Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 schedule finalised
88.article_body: The schedule for the Super 4 stage of Asia Cup 2022 has been finalised after Pakistan won the last group match against Hong Kong. India will face Pakistan on Sunday in their first Super 4 match. India will then face Sri Lanka on Tuesday and Afghanistan on Thursday. Sri Lanka and Afghanistan will kick off the Super 4 stage tomorrow.

89.title: Actor Richard Roat, who appeared in 'Seinfeld' & 'Friends', dies at 89
89.article_body: Veteran TV actor Richard Roat, who appeared in shows like 'Friends', 'Baywatch' and 'Seinfeld', passed away aged 89. Roat died in Orange County, California, on August 5. The actor, who made his acting debut in the 1960s, appeared in over 100 projects. His last TV appearance was in the crime thriller '24', in the year 2009.

90.title: I'll always say Messi but this year Benzema deserves to win Ballon d'Or: Alba
90.article_body: Lionel Messi's ex-Barcelona teammate Jordi Alba, when asked who should win the Ballon d'Or this year, said, "I'd always say Messi but this year Karim Benzema deserves it." In 26 matches for PSG in Ligue 1, forward Messi scored six goals in the 2021-2022 season. In La Liga last season, Real Madrid forward Benzema scored 44 times in 46 appearances.

91.title: Oscar Piastri to replace Daniel Ricciardo at McLaren in F1 next season
91.article_body: Formula 2 world champion Oscar Piastri will replace Daniel Ricciardo at McLaren in Formula One for the 2023 season. This comes as a tribunal passed a verdict in Piastri and McLaren's favour in a contract regulations case brought up by Alpine F1. "I'm extremely excited to be making my F1 debut...I'm looking forward to working hard alongside Norris," said Piastri.

92.title: 'Bring down Bollywood' brigade is running an industry of its own: Swara
92.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker, opening up on 'boycott Bollywood' trend on social media, said the 'bring down Bollywood' brigade is running a small industry of its own. "They're profiting from it. All these Twitter handles. It's like an industry on its own," she added. "A lot of negative hysteria has been generated around Bollywood...and...a lot of it is lies," said Swara.

93.title: Ukraine's Kostyuk rejects handshake with Belarus's Azarenka at US Open, taps racquet
93.article_body: Ukraine's Marta Kostyuk on Thursday refused to shake hands with her Belarusian opponent Victoria Azarenka and instead opted for a racquet tap after their second round match at US Open 2022. Kostyuk later said she had texted Azarenka ahead of the game about it though the two didn't speak about it. Kostyuk lost the match 2-6, 3-6.

94.title: Tutor in Delhi locks sisters in room, beats them for not doing homework; DCW shares pics
94.article_body: A private tutor has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly beating two sisters, aged six and eight, for not completing their homework. The Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) had shared pictures of scars on the girls' bodies and had stated that the tutor "brutally" beat them up with a plastic pipe after locking them in a room.

95.title: CBI arrests TMC leader in chit fund case, recovers ₹80 lakh: Reports
95.article_body: The CBI arrested Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader and Halisahar Municipality Chairman Raju Sahani on Friday in a chit fund scam case registered in Kolkata in 2018. The agency recovered ₹80 lakh in cash, a firearm with live cartridges and documents of properties worth ₹2.75 crore, reports said. Sahani is accused of misappropriating funds of a company called Sunmarg Welfare Organisation.

96.title: Delay in sorting out public complaints will not be tolerated: CM Yogi
96.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has said that any delay in addressing the complaints of the public would not be tolerated. During his visit to review various developmental projects in Balrampur, CM Yogi instructed the officials to take concrete action against criminals under the zero-tolerance policy. Notably, CM Yogi also offered prayers at the Devipatan Shaktipeeth temple in Tulsipur.

97.title: 'Uncertain' whether TMC govt will continue till Dec: BJP's Dilip Ghosh
97.article_body: West Bengal BJP leader Dilip Ghosh on Friday claimed that it's "uncertain" whether the TMC government will continue till December. There could be another Assembly poll by the end of this year, Ghosh said. "Those BJP MLAs who have defected to TMC might come back to the saffron camp along with some more MLAs as interest," Ghosh added.

98.title: Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka calls on Prez Wickremesinghe
98.article_body: Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Gopal Baglay visited the country's President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Friday to discuss ways to strengthen bilateral ties. Baglay also gifted a statue of Maitri Buddha to Wickremesinghe. "They reviewed all-round bilateral cooperation and agreed to further strengthen close India-Sri Lanka ties in all spheres," the High Commission of India in Colombo tweeted.

99.title: Pakistan record their biggest-ever T20I win after dismissing Hong Kong for 38
99.article_body: Pakistan recorded their biggest-ever victory in T20I cricket by registering a 155-run win against Hong Kong. Pakistan set up a total of 193/2 before dismissing Hong Kong for 38 runs, the lowest-ever T20I total in the history of Asia Cup. It is also Hong Kong's lowest-ever T20I total. Pakistan have qualified for the Super 4 stage of Asia Cup 2022.

100.title: BSF develops tear gas shell-dropping drone system for security forces
100.article_body: A tear gas shell-dropping drone system has been developed by the Border Security Force (BSF) that can be used by police to control protesters and rioters, a senior officer said on Friday. According to the officer, the system "will be a potential force multiplier for the security forces working in the law-and-order management domain".

101.title: We do & don't brag: Assam CM Himanta Sarma tweets to Kejriwal
101.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma tagged Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in a tweet on Friday writing about the development work in education sector in the state and stated, "We do and don't brag." He wrote, "Despite being small...compared to Delhi, Assam constructing 21 state-of-art medical colleges/hospitals: 06 completed; 03 to be completed this year, rest in different stages of completion."

102.title: 18 killed, including pro-Taliban cleric, in Afghan mosque blast
102.article_body: At least 18 people were killed and 23 were injured after an explosion ripped through a crowded mosque in west Afghanistan's Herat city on Friday, Taliban officials said. The bomb exploded during the noon prayers at the Guzargah Mosque. Videos showed the mosque's courtyard littered with bodies. The deceased included a senior cleric close to the Taliban.

103.title: It's one of the most challenging roles I've played: Mouni on Brahmastra
103.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy, while speaking about her role in the upcoming movie 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva', said, "It's one of the most challenging roles that I have ever played." "It is Ayan's (director) brainchild," she added. "It is the most interesting role I have gotten to play, till date," said Mouni, who will play the antagonist in the film.

104.title: Nadal is a big favourite also at US Open: Defending champion Medvedev
104.article_body: On being asked if he felt he was the favourite to retain the men's singles title at US Open 2022, defending champion Daniil Medvedev said, "I don't want to put pressure on anybody, but I think Rafael Nadal is a big favourite also." He added, "He won...last time he played here against me actually. He won two slams this year."

105.title: Judge found hanging at his official residence in Odisha's Cuttack
105.article_body: The body of a special POCSO judge was found hanging at his official residence in Odisha's Cuttack on Friday, police said. The deceased has been identified as 49-year-old Subash Kumar Behari. According to police, prima facie it appears to be a case of death by suicide. The incident occurred when Behari's wife and children were not at home, police added.

106.title: Smuggling of drugs from across border is on the rise: J&K DGP
106.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Director General of Police Dilbag Singh on Friday said smuggling of drugs from across the border is on the rise and Pakistan is using it to fund militancy in Kashmir. "People have to fight this strongly as many youths are falling prey to drugs," Singh said. Infiltration along the Line of Control has come down, he added.

107.title: Difficult to imagine he's not here: Shefali on Sidharth's death anniversary
107.article_body: Remembering late actor Sidharth Shukla on his first death anniversary, actress Shefali Jariwala said, "It's very difficult to imagine that he is not here." "Sometimes I go blank just thinking about it, because I still haven't come to terms with it," she added. Calling Sidharth a fun-loving, dynamic, charming and large-hearted person, Shefali said he loved his friends a lot.

108.title: Won't bow my head before BJP: Abhishek Banerjee after ED appearance
108.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew and TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee on Friday said, "[I will] not bow my head before the BJP." This comes after Enforcement Directorate (ED) interrogated him in the alleged coal pilferage scam. "I've attacked...[Amit Shah's son] over the national flag issue but that does not mean the ED...can be used to threaten me," Abhishek added.

109.title: TN CM to hand over Tricolour to Rahul ahead of Bharat Jodo Yatra
109.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will participate in an event in Tamil Nadu's Kanniyakumari where CM MK Stalin will hand him the national flag ahead of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', PTI reported. Rahul is set to undertake the 3,570-km 'padayatra' from Kanniyakumari to Srinagar on September 8. Rahul will reportedly attend a prayer meeting for his father, former PM Rajiv Gandhi.

110.title: Maharashtra cabinet expansion 'soon': BJP's Sudhir Mungantiwar
110.article_body: Maharashtra minister and BJP leader Sudhir Mungantiwar on Friday said an expansion of the state cabinet is expected to take place "soon" to fill up existing vacancies. "We recently formed government and inducted 20 ministers, including CM and Deputy CM," Mungantiwar said. "According to norms, Maharashtra can have 43 ministers. There can be 23 more ministers in the...government," he added.

111.title: China's Shenzhou-14 astronauts successfully complete 6-hour spacewalk
111.article_body: Astronauts Chen Dong and Liu Yang on board China's Tiangong space station on the six-month Shenzhou-14 mission successfully completed a six-hour spacewalk on Friday. The duo installed external parts to the module and tested its functions with another astronaut coordinating from inside. China has landed a rover on Mars and sent probes to the Moon under its space programme.

112.title: Lightning strikes kill 3, injure 2 in separate incidents in UP
112.article_body: Three people were killed and two others were injured in separate incidents of lightning strike in UP on Friday. In Mirzapur district, four people who had taken shelter under a tree were struck by lightning, police said. Two of them later succumbed to their injuries. Meanwhile, a lightning strike claimed the life of a farmer in Raebareli district, police informed.

113.title: 2 IAEA inspectors to stay at Zaporizhzhia plant permanently: Russia
113.article_body: Two inspectors from the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) will be permanently posted at the Russian-controlled Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine, a Russian diplomat told media on Friday. A delegation of IAEA inspectors visited the plant on Thursday to assess damage to "physical integrity" of the facility. Notably, the plant has come under repeated shelling in the recent weeks.

114.title: Bairstow ruled out of T20 WC hours after being named in squad, ECB cites 'freak accident'
114.article_body: England wicketkeeper-batter Jonny Bairstow has been ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022, hours after England announced the squad. "Bairstow sustained a lower limb injury in a freak accident whilst playing golf on Friday in Leeds. He will see a specialist next week to ascertain the full extent of the injury," the England and Wales Cricket Board stated.

115.title: Female employees to get 60-day leave in case of child's death soon after birth: Centre
115.article_body: All female central government employees will be entitled for 60 days special maternity leave in case of death of a child soon after birth, the Department of Personnel and Training (DoPT) said. The decision has been taken keeping in view the "potential emotional trauma" caused due to stillbirth or death of a child soon after birth, the department stated.

116.title: The confidence Suryakumar showed while hitting big shots was superb: Afridi
116.article_body: After Indian batter Suryakumar Yadav scored 68*(26) against Hong Kong, former Pakistan skipper Shahid Afridi said that the confidence showed by the cricketer while "hitting" big shots "was superb". "I sat to watch Virat [Kohli's] batting...but when Suryakumar came in...he hit his first ball for four, then the second ball...and came in with a licence to attack everything," Afridi said.

117.title: Centre distributing jumlas: Priyanka on unemployment suicides
117.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra tweeted on reports stating a rise in suicide deaths due to unemployment and asked "how long" the Centre was going to "distribute jumlas (false promises)". Priyanka's tweet claimed a 26% rise in suicide deaths due to unemployment in 2021 than 2020. She added that the government didn't have a cure or answer.

118.title: Who are the Indian-origin CEOs of some of the world's largest companies?
118.article_body: Laxman Narasimhan has been named the next CEO of Starbucks. Chanel, in December, named Leena Nair as its global CEO. Twitter named Parag Agrawal as its CEO in November. Sandeep Kataria became the first Indian to hold the post of Bata's global CEO. Sundar Pichai became Google CEO in 2015, while Satya Nadella was named Microsoft CEO in 2014.

119.title: Suryakumar has the ability to bat through any situation: Nehra
119.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said India batter Suryakumar Yadav has the ability to bat through any situation. "No matter whichever position you play Suryakumar, he'll remain crucial for India. He has done well wherever he has batted," he added. Suryakumar was adjudged 'Player of the Match' against Hong Kong at Asia Cup 2022. Batting at number four, he scored 68*(26).

120.title: Something major could happen: BJP leader as Abhishek Banerjee questioned
120.article_body: West Bengal BJP President Sukanta Majumdar said "something major" could happen in the ED investigation into TMC's Abhishek Banerjee over the alleged coal scam. "Congress and CPI(M) leaders will swallow their own allegations that the BJP and TMC are in an understanding," said Majumdar. The TMC said this was an admission that there is collusion between BJP and ED.

121.title: Ranveer, Vicky dance to Moosewala's song after Filmfare wins, video viral
121.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing Ranveer Singh and Vicky Kaushal celebrating after winning Best Actor and Best Actor (Critics') respectively at 67th Filmfare Awards. In the video that has gone viral on social media, the actors could be seen dancing to Sidhu Moosewala's song 'Gabru'. While Ranveer won the award for '83', Vicky bagged the award for 'Sardar Udham'.

122.title: Massive fire breaks out at Haryana market; 130 shops damaged
122.article_body: About 130 shops at the Rehri Market in Haryana's Panchkula sustained damages after a massive fire broke out in the area, fire department officials said on Friday. As many as 15 fire tenders were deployed to extinguish the fire, which caused extensive loss to goods inside the shops, according to an official. No casualties were reported in the incident.

123.title: Australia to accept nearly 2 lakh permanent migrants, cap raised for 1st time in yrs
123.article_body: For the first time in a decade, Australia has raised the number of permanent migrants that it will accept this financial year to 1,95,000. "We want people...to have a mortgage, to raise a family, to join the Australian family," said Australian PM Anthony Albanese. Australia's unemployment rate is at a 50-year low but there are around 4,80,000 job vacancies there.

124.title: Woman arrested for killing 3 daughters in Bihar's Buxar district
124.article_body: A woman was arrested on Friday in Bihar's Buxar district for allegedly murdering her three daughters by strangulation, a police official said. According to police, the accused has admitted that she strangled her daughters, aged between four and eight years, to death on Thursday night. However, she did not specify the motive behind her action, police added.

125.title: At 36, I'll be happy to end the season in top 5: World no. 3 Nadal
125.article_body: After Rafael Nadal became the first player to qualify for the season-ending ATP Finals in Turin, the world number three said, "One more year at the age of 36- finish the year probably, if nothing goes wrong, in the top five." Nadal qualified after winning the second round at US Open 2022. Nadal has never won the season-ending ATP tournament.

126.title: Look out circular issued against social media influencer Bobby Kataria
126.article_body: Delhi Police has issued a look out circular against social media influencer Balvinder alias Bobby Kataria over a video where he was seen smoking a cigarette on board a SpiceJet flight in January. "Our teams had recently raided one of his locations, but he was not found there. Now look out circular has been issued against him," police said.

127.title: 20 more Jammu Congress leaders quit party in support of Azad: Report
127.article_body: As many as 20 leaders of District Congress Committee-Jammu North quit Congress on Friday in support of former party veteran Ghulam Nabi Azad, ANI reported. This comes after 36 Congress leaders resigned on Thursday. Before that, another 64 Congress leaders had resigned from the party, days after Azad left Congress. Azad is reportedly planning to launch a new national party.

128.title: 2 Maoists killed in encounter with security forces in Jharkhand
128.article_body: Two Maoists were killed in an encounter with security forces in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan district on Friday, a senior police official said. The joint operation was carried out by CRPF's CoBRA, Jharkhand Jaguar, and the state police, he added. An SLR, over 100 live cartridges, magazines, detonators and wireless sets were reportedly recovered from the slain Maoists' possession, he informed.

129.title: Truck carrying 46 dead cattle found in Gujarat; driver escapes
129.article_body: Police in Gujarat's Valsad stopped a container truck carrying 46 dead cattle inside. "The container [truck's] driver and owner had not made water, food or air ventilation available in the container, which led to the death of the cattle," Valsad SP said. The driver of the truck escaped when police stopped the vehicle on the Sutharpada-Nashik road for checking.

130.title: Teacher burns 3-year-old boy's private parts for urinating in underpants in Karnataka
130.article_body: A teacher in an Anganwadi daycare centre in Karnataka's Tumkur district burned the genitals of a 3-year-old boy. The teacher, along with her assistant, burned the child's genitals with matchstick for urinating in his underpants. She earlier tried to issue an apology and resolve the matter to avoid legal action. Police officials informed that the crime took place on Monday.

131.title: Internal Congress election rolls must be made public: Tharoor
131.article_body: Senior Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor and Pradyut Bordoloi have written to the party's Central Election Authority, demanding electoral rolls to elect the party's next president be made public. Bordoloi demanded the state-wise electoral rolls be uploaded on the Congress website. Earlier, party leaders Manish Tewari, Karti Chidambaram and Anand Sharma said the move would ensure transparency.

132.title: Disappointing to miss out CWG due to COVID: Midfielder Navjot Kaur
132.article_body: Indian women's hockey team midfielder Navjot Kaur, who has more than 200 international caps, said missing a major tournament like Commonwealth Games was "hard to accept" as she could not compete in Birmingham Games after contracting COVID-19. The 27-year-old tested positive for COVID-19 when she was in Nottingham for a training camp. "I had no major symptoms," she added.

133.title: Bail plea of Tyagi, arrested for abusing Noida woman, rejected
133.article_body: A Noida court rejected the bail application filed by politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested for assaulting and abusing a woman in his residential society on August 5. The 34-year-old was arrested on August 9 from Meerut by the Noida Police. While Tyagi had claimed to be a BJP functionary, the party had denied any links with him.

134.title: Uttarakhand Police ranks first in recovering stolen goods: NCRB
134.article_body: Uttarakhand Police have topped the list in effectiveness of state police forces in recovering stolen goods, the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) said. In 2021, Uttarakhand recorded 68.7% in the rate of recovery of stolen property and goods, which was double the national average of 30.2%. Uttarakhand Police also cracked the most number of theft cases, DGP Ashok Kumar said.

135.title: What is the significance of Chhatrapati Shivaji's seal used in the new Navy ensign?
135.article_body: Indian Navy's new ensign bears the seal of the Maratha emperor Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, who is known to have laid the foundation for the modern Navy in India. The blue octagon encasing the National Emblem represents the eight directions, symbolising the Navy's "multidirectional reach and operational capability". The anchor depicted below the Emblem represents steadfastness, the Navy said.

136.title: Allegations against Murugha Mutt seer 'serious': Cong's Siddaramaiah
136.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah said the allegations against the chief pontiff of Sri Murugha Mutt were "serious" in nature. "Police should carry out [an] impartial investigation based on the complaint filed by the girls and reveal the truth," Siddaramaiah tweeted. His comment comes days after the chief pontiff of the mutt in Karnataka's Chitradurga was accused of sexually abusing minor girls.

137.title: Won't tolerate corruption: Bihar CM after RJD leader's resignation
137.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said corrupt people are not being sheltered by his government nor would any act of corruption be tolerated under his regime. Kumar was reacting to RJD MLC Kartik Kumar's resignation as state minister after facing allegations in connection with a 2014 kidnapping case. A district court had ruled that Kartik cannot be arrested until September 1.

138.title: Club owner, 2 others sent to 7-day judicial custody in Sonali's murder case
138.article_body: The special Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) court sent Edwin Nunes, owner of Goa's Curlies beach shack, and two other alleged drug peddlers to seven-day judicial custody in connection with the murder of BJP leader Sonali Phogat. The trio has applied for bail, which will be heard on September 6.

139.title: Kashmir Files was made by an unknown director, yet it collected ₹250 cr: RGV
139.article_body: Ram Gopal Varma, talking about Vivek Agnihotri's directorial 'The Kashmir Files', said, "It's made by an unknown director whom Bollywood never took seriously...Yet, it ended up making ₹250 crores domestically." He added that it's "the slowest film ever made". "It goes against whatever we, as filmmakers, learnt what not to be made...There's no screenplay...no interval, no climax," said Varma.

140.title: 32-yr-old BSF constable found dead in Tripura's Khowai district
140.article_body: A 32-year-old Border Security Force (BSF) constable, Balu Ram Kuri, posted in Tripura's Khowai district was found dead at the sector headquarters at Khasiamangal in Teliamura area. Kuri was reportedly on sentry duty at the battalion headquarters. "His body was found lying in a pool of blood. Our officials...sent the body for postmortem," Teliamura sub-divisional police officer said.

141.title: Rohit has taken on that role of playing with an aggressive mindset: Saba
141.article_body: Commenting on Rohit Sharma's recent string of low scores, Saba Karim said the India captain is a big player and he'll certainly know what needs to be done to score big. "But...he has taken on that role of playing with an aggressive mindset, which is important for at least one of the top three to have," he added.

142.title: PM Modi's Mangaluru tour will see development or disaster?: Siddaramaiah
142.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi visited Karnataka's Mangaluru to inaugurate various projects on Friday, Congress leader Siddaramaiah commented on the former's trip to the coastal city. "Welcome PM Modi...Is this visit of yours a tour to see the development? Or to see the disaster?...You completely erased the names of the 3 banks. Is this development? Or [a] disaster?" Siddaramaiah said.

143.title: Will fight local polls in alliance with Shinde group: Maha BJP Prez
143.article_body: Maharashtra BJP President Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Friday said his party will contest the local elections in alliance with the Shiv Sena faction led by CM Eknath Shinde. As part of the BJP's Mission 2024, in which Central ministers will go to Lok Sabha constituencies to check welfare projects, Chandrapur will be visited by Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri, Bawankule added.

144.title: BJP leaders roam around with bags full of money to poach MLAs: Baghel
144.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Friday criticised BJP and said the party cannot tolerate opposition, so they roam around with bags full of money and poach MLAs of opposition parties. Speaking in Raipur, Baghel said, "They also try to scare leaders in the name of ED and IT departments." Baghel further alleged that BJP doesn't work for the people's interest.

145.title: BCCI bought Neeraj Chopra's javelin for ₹1.5 crore during auction of PM's gifts: Report
145.article_body: The winning bid of ₹1.5 crore for Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra's javelin, when PM Narendra Modi's collection of mementos was e-auctioned last year, was made by BCCI, an official told PTI. "As an organisation we're proud that we have a sporting good of one of India's greatest athletes," the official was quoted as saying by PTI.

146.title: Warner trolled for 'Lucky man mate' comment on Anushka's photo shared by Kohli, responds
146.article_body: Australia opener David Warner was trolled after he commented "Lucky man mate" on Anushka Sharma's photo shared by Virat Kohli on Instagram, with a user writing, "Are you jealous?" Warner responded, writing, "It's a saying...in Australia...like I'd say I'm lucky to have Candice so when we say to others we say 'you're lucky mate'...Interpretation is always going to be different."

147.title: Woman pushed off train for resisting rape dies in Haryana, son found alone in coach
147.article_body: A 30-year-old woman died after she was thrown out of a running train by a man who attempted to molest her in Haryana's Fatehabad, police said. The woman's 9-year-old son, who was travelling with his mother, was found crying alone in the train coach by his father at Tohana station. The accused, who jumped out of the train, was arrested.

148.title: Switzerland's 2nd largest bank Credit Suisse looking at laying off 5,000 people: Reports
148.article_body: Switzerland's second-largest bank Credit Suisse is considering cutting around 5,000 jobs, about one position in ten, as part of a cost reduction drive, reports said. Credit Suisse has already said it will cut costs below 15.5 billion Swiss francs ($15.8 billion) in the medium term, versus an annualised 16.8 billion francs this year.

149.title: Congress reduced to bhai-behan party: JP Nadda in Haryana
149.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Friday criticised Congress and said it had been reduced to a bhai-behan (brother-sister) party. Addressing a rally in Haryana's Kaithal, Nadda said, "The BJP is the only democratic party of the country that cares about every section of society." He further said the Congress divided people on the basis of caste, religion and region.

150.title: Facebook shutting down Neighbourhoods following tests in US and Canada
150.article_body: Facebook's parent company Meta confirmed that it's shutting down Neighbourhoods, its Nextdoor clone that was being tested since last year in US and Canada to standardise the way neighbours connect and share local information on Facebook. The company said it realised the best way to move forward in this area was to allow people to continue to use Facebook Groups.

151.title: Sanjay Kapoor cheated on me during our marriage, says Maheep Kapoor
151.article_body: Maheep Kapoor revealed on 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' season 2 that her husband, actor Sanjay Kapoor, cheated on her in the early days of their marriage. She further revealed that she had "walked out" with their daughter Shanaya. Speaking about revealing this, Maheep told India Today, "I am hoping that women will understand that everything is not hunky dory."

152.title: Haridwar hate speech accused Jitendra Tyagi surrenders before court
152.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh Shia Central Waqf Board chairperson Jitendra Narayan Tyagi, who is an accused in the Haridwar hate speech case, on Friday surrendered before a court in Haridwar. This comes after the Supreme Court turned down his application for the extension of his bail on Monday. "I've full faith in the judiciary and law of the country," Tyagi said.

153.title: Hrithik rejects 'Brahmastra 2' due to 'Krrish 4' & 'Ramayana': Report
153.article_body: Hrithik Roshan has reportedly rejected the offer to star in 'Brahmastra 2'. The actor was reportedly offered the lead role named Dev in the film. "Hrithik is...doing two high-on visual effects films, Krrish 4 and Ramayana. He felt...doing Brahmastra 2 would mean too much of...time investment on another VFX-heavy film...He wants to do more films," a source told Bollywood Hungama.

154.title: Bihar locals carry patient to hospital on makeshift boat amid floods
154.article_body: A video has emerged showing two men pushing a makeshift boat through knee-deep water to get a patient to hospital in a flood-hit village of Bihar's Bhagalpur. Another man held a saline bottle while sitting beside the patient on the boat, which was apparently made of water barrels and bamboo sticks. "Ganga Mandal was severely ill," the village head said.

155.title: I've been offered films by 2 very big B'wood producers: Karthikeya 2's Nikhil
155.article_body: Actor Nikhil Siddhartha, who was recently seen in 'Karthikeya 2', said in an interview that two "very big" production houses of Bollywood have approached him for their upcoming films. He added that many people from Bollywood called him and "showered their love" on his film. Nikhil further said he doesn't differentiate between Bollywood and Tollywood, adding, "It's all Indian cinema."

156.title: Difficult to find momentum with not much gametime: Rajkumar on KL Rahul
156.article_body: Former India skipper Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said that it is "difficult" for batter KL Rahul to find "momentum with not much gametime". "Rahul is coming back after a long injury lay-off...He has given some big performances for India and having been appointed vice-captain shows how much the team management has faith in him," Sharma said.

157.title: Telangana Martyrs' Memorial in Hyd set to be inaugurated by yr-end: KTR
157.article_body: Telangana Martyrs' Memorial in Hyderabad is getting ready to be inaugurated by the end of 2022, minister KT Rama Rao (KTR) announced on Friday. The 50-metre-tall structure is designed in the form of 'diya' in honour of those who sacrificed their lives for the separate state of Telangana. It is being built at an estimated cost of ₹80 crore.

158.title: Gallantry award winners exhibit opens at Rajouri Garden metro station
158.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation has inaugurated a permanent exhibition on gallantry award recipients of the armed forces at Rajouri Garden metro station. Named 'Veerta aur Vikas', the exhibition is spread across over 100 feet, with 13 panels dedicated to the efforts of the gallantry awardees. The exhibition also has a section on major events in India since 1947.

159.title: K'taka's Murugha Mutt seer sent to 4-day police custody for raping 2 minor girls
159.article_body: A district court in Karnataka's Chitradurga on Friday sent Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, the chief pontiff of Sri Murugha Mutt, to four-day police custody for allegedly raping two minor girls. The police had, however, sought his custody for five days. The seer was arrested on Thursday night.

160.title: Half-naked Odisha woman found dead in Gurugram, police suspect rape
160.article_body: A half-naked woman was found dead at a plot in Gurugram's DLF Phase 3 on Thursday, police said. The deceased, who was 50 years old, is suspected to have been raped, they said. The woman hailed from Odisha and her body was kept in the mortuary for post-mortem. Initial findings indicate the woman was strangled.

161.title: Germany to pay 28 mn euros to families of Olympics attack victims
161.article_body: Germany and the families of the Israeli athletes killed in the 1972 Munich Olympics terrorist attack have agreed on a compensation amount of 28 million euros, Berlin said on Friday. Last month, the families of the victims had said that they were unhappy with the German compensation offer. The 1972 attack was carried out by Palestinian terror group Black September.

162.title: SL mock B'desh over 'no world class bowler' remark after knocking them out of Asia Cup
162.article_body: Sri Lanka mocked Bangladesh over their Team Director Khaled Mahmud's remark that Sri Lanka don't have any world class bowlers in their side. After knocking Bangladesh out of the Asia Cup 2022, Sri Lanka commented on a Facebook post showing the match scorecard, writing, "Bangladesh, who without world class bowlers, lost the game, is it?"

163.title: Don't agree that KL Rahul needs to be given time: Reetinder Sodhi
163.article_body: Former India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi said that batter KL Rahul doesn't need to be "given time". "I don't agree that Rahul needs to be given time because where do you have time left?...His strike rate against Hong Kong is very worrying," Sodhi said. "He has great numbers, but you just can't rely on them all the time," he added.

164.title: I've been her fan since I was a kid: Ajla on facing Serena at US Open 2022
164.article_body: Ahead of US Open 2022 third round match against 23-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams, who is expected to retire after the tournament, Australia's Ajla Tomljanovic said, "It's going to be a huge moment no matter the outcome." She added, "I've been a Serena fan since I was a kid. On Friday night I'll just be a competitor."

165.title: No such proposal before govt: Fadnavis on reports of 2 civic bodies in Pune
165.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis opened up about reports stating that the state government was planning to bifurcate Pune Municipal Corporation and said, "There is no such proposal before the state government." "I'm not going to be guardian minister of Pune. Also, I am not going to contest Lok Sabha elections from Pune," he added.

166.title: FIR against 7 minors for violence at Yerwada observation home
166.article_body: Seven minors were booked after violence was reported from the government-run observation home in Yerwada. On August 25, juveniles were playing football when a brawl and stone-pelting started after some minors were hit by a ball, police said. The minors were booked under sections 143, 144, 147, 149, 323, 504 and 336 of the Indian Penal Code.

167.title: Woman dies after treatment at IVF centre run by fake doctor in Gr Noida
167.article_body: A woman reportedly died of 'gross negligence' during treatment at an In-Vitro Fertilisation (IVF) centre run by a fake doctor in Greater Noida. The woman was taking IVF treatment from Priyaranjan Thakur for the past two months. She fell ill during treatment on August 19 and slipped into a coma. She was admitted to another hospital where she died.

168.title: No reservation in Delhi colleges for students passing from NCR schools: HC
168.article_body: A student from Delhi who passed his class 12 examination from an NCR school cannot avail reservation benefits available to "Delhi candidates" for admission to colleges in Delhi, the Delhi HC has held. The order was passed on a petition by a student who passed class 12 from a Gurugram school and sought reservation benefits for college admission in Delhi.

169.title: 6 booked for defrauding Pune investors of ₹1.68 crore
169.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have booked six people, including the Director of JBC Capital Private Limited, for allegedly defrauding investors of ₹1.68 crore, said officials. The accused were identified as Rahul Gulabsingh Jakhad, Director of JBC Capital Private Limited, Ramhari Munde, among others. Jakhad would allegedly approach investors, promising them a 10% return every month.

170.title: Samajwadi Party delegation meets Shrikant Tyagi's family in Noida
170.article_body: A delegation of Samajwadi Party leaders met politician Shrikant Tyagi's family members on Friday in Noida. The party had earlier announced that its members would meet Tyagi's family to inquire about the harassment faced by him in police custody. Tyagi is in jail for allegedly assaulting a woman. "We're here to meet both the parties," SP leader Sunil Choudhary said.

171.title: Anti-Muslim tweets 'liked' by Chaayos' Twitter handle, Founder says it was hacked
171.article_body: Cafe chain Chaayos is facing criticism online for 'liking' anti-Muslim tweets. After many Twitter users shared screenshots of the 'likes section' of Chaayos' official account, it said, "There was an offensive tweet that was inadvertently liked from our account. Chaayos detests and denies any view mentioned in the said tweet." Chaayos Founder Nitin Saluja later said the account was hacked.

172.title: 4 persons, including 2 women, held in Ambala; 1 kg heroin seized
172.article_body: Four persons, including two women, were arrested and one kilogram of heroin was recovered from their vehicle during checking near cantonment area in Ambala on Friday, police said. Based on a tip-off, police set up a checkpoint on Ambala-Delhi Highway, Superintendent of Police said. Police intercepted the vehicle and found narcotics hidden inside the handbags of the women, SP added.

173.title: Playing doubles is good money, makes my girlfriend happy: Kyrgios
173.article_body: Eighth seeds Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis entered the men's doubles second round at US Open 2022 after defeating unseeded Hugo Gaston and Lorenzo Musetti on Thursday. Following the win, Kyrgios said, "Honestly, I'd rather play doubles than practice. It's good money too and makes my girlfriend happy." Kyrgios and Kokkinakis won Australian Open 2022 men's doubles title in January.

174.title: Motorcyclists to be penalised for taking shelter below flyovers in Bengaluru
174.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police has decided to impose a fine on motorcyclists for taking shelter at underpasses and below flyovers during rainfall.
