"When vehicles are parked on roads below underpasses and flyovers in the rainy season it causes accidents," an official said. A fine of ₹500 has been proposed for the first-time offenders and case against repeat offenders, police said.

175.title: Ben Kingsley to reprise his role from Iron Man 3 in Wonder Man: Reports
175.article_body: Actor Ben Kingsley is all set to reprise the role of Trevor Slattery in the upcoming 'Wonder Man' series from Marvel Studios, as per reports. Ben's Slattery appeared in 'Iron Man 3' and 'Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings'. Destin Daniel Cretton, who directed 'Shang-Chi', will reportedly serve as an executive producer and co-creator of the series.

176.title: Pawan has a larger-than-life personality, is a gun freak: Director Saagar
176.article_body: Director Saagar K Chandra, who worked with Pawan Kalyan in film 'Bheemla Nayak', said in an interview that the actor has a larger-than-life personality. "He adds certain nuances to...character which is all Pawan Kalyan. When you see a scene, that 20-30 per cent extra layering is his art and knowledge," he added. Saagar further said Pawan is a "gun freak".

177.title: Delhi LG 'illegally awarded' interior designing contract to daughter: AAP
177.article_body: AAP MP Sanjay Singh has accused Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena of illegally awarding his daughter an interior designing contract. "Saxena, during his term as KVIC chairman, misused his position and awarded a contract for interior designing of a Khadi lounge in Mumbai to...daughter," he alleged. "He violated..the KVIC Act 1961," Singh said, adding PM Modi should immediately sack him.

178.title: Tourism body seizes Hyd amusement park over ₹16.70 cr unpaid fees
178.article_body: Telangana State Tourism Development Corporation on Thursday confiscated an amusement park named Snow World in Hyderabad after it failed to pay the lease rent and other fees totalling ₹16.70 crore. Officials from the tourism body closed the park's entrance. The park will not be opened to the public until the administration has paid all outstanding debts, an official said.

179.title: Ravindra Jadeja ruled out of Asia Cup 2022, replaced by Axar Patel
179.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been ruled out of Asia Cup 2022 after sustaining a right knee injury. He is currently under the supervision of the BCCI medical team, the BCCI stated.  He has been replaced by Axar Patel for remainder of the tournament. Axar was earlier named as one of the standbys in the squad.

180.title: SC grants interim bail to activist Teesta in case related to Gujarat riots
180.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday granted interim bail to activist Teesta Setalvad in a case related to the 2002 Gujarat riots. Setalvad was asked to afford complete cooperation in the probe of the alleged conspiracy and surrender her passport. She was arrested on June 25 for allegedly falsifying evidence to 'frame' innocent people in the riot cases.

181.title: We won't sell oil to countries that set price caps: Russia
181.article_body: Russia will stop selling oil to countries that impose price caps on Russia's energy resources, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. "We simply will not cooperate with them on non-market principles," Peskov added, saying the caps will lead to significant destabilisation of the global oil market. Earlier, the European Union imposed a partial ban on Russian oil purchases over Ukraine war.

182.title: Meta, Qualcomm sign deal to produce custom virtual reality chips
182.article_body: Meta Platforms entered into an agreement with chip-maker Qualcomm to produce custom chipsets for its Quest virtual reality devices. The engineering and product teams of the companies will work together to produce the chips, which will be powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon platforms, both the firms said in a statement at a consumer electronics conference in Berlin on Friday.

183.title: Bridgerton's Charithra Chandran wears Manish Malhotra for magazine shoot
183.article_body: Actress Charithra Chandran, known for portraying Edwina Sharma in television series 'Bridgerton', wore designer Manish Malhotra's collection to feature on the cover of Conde Nast Traveller's Indian edition. The outfits she wore are from Malhotra's Khaab Mijwan 2022 collection. The Indian-origin actress shared pictures on social media, writing, "I'll never say no to dressing up as an Indian Bride."

184.title: Difficult for IAEA to impartially assess Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant: Ukraine
184.article_body: Ukraine's state nuclear company, Energoatom, said it'll be "difficult" for the UN nuclear watchdog, IAEA, to make an impartial assessment of the situation at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant due to Russian interference. The IAEA team, which arrived at the Russian-occupied power station on Thursday, wasn't allowed to enter the plant's crisis centre, where Russia has stationed troops, it added.

185.title: INS Vikrant is a significant step for India's maritime security: Rahul
185.article_body: After India's first indigenously-built aircraft carrier, Vikrant, was commissioned in a ceremony on Friday, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the 860ft long and 197ft tall vessel is "a significant step for India's maritime security". "Many congratulations to the Indian Navy, the Naval Design Bureau and Cochin Shipyard for the many years of hard work," Rahul tweeted.

186.title: Earthquake of 4.9 magnitude hits Andaman and Nicobar Islands
186.article_body: An earthquake of 4.9 magnitude on the Richter scale shook Andaman and Nicobar Islands this afternoon. According to reports, the epicentre of the earthquake was 108 kilometre North-Northeast of Diglipur. The epicentre was estimated to be at a depth of 10 kilometre. No casualties or damages have been reported by authorities so far.

187.title: Piyush Goyal to meet American counterparts on US visit next week
187.article_body: Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal will embark on a six-day US visit starting September 5. He will hold bilateral meetings with his American counterparts to discuss ways to boost trade and investment ties. Goyal will also participate in the two-day ministerial meeting of Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity on September 8 and 9 in Los Angeles.

188.title: 'Brahmāstra' made at a cost of ₹410 crore, most expensive Hindi film ever: Report
188.article_body: Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmāstra' has been made on a budget of ₹410 crore, as per reports. This would make it the costliest Hindi film of all time. The budget reportedly excludes publicity expenses and the high budget is largely due to the extensive VFX work that has been done on the film, reports added.

189.title: He was my guru: Ankita Lokhande on Sushant Singh Rajput
189.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande recently appeared as a guest on 'DID Super Moms' and broke down after watching a performance dedicated to late actor Sushant Singh Rajput. She said, "It would not have been possible for me to be what I am today without Sushant, he was my guru." Ankita and Sushant were in a relationship from 2010 until 2016.

190.title: INS Vikrant is a collective effort of all governments since 1999: Congress
190.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi commissioned country's first indigenous aircraft carrier INS Vikrant, Congress criticised the PM and asked whether he would acknowledge collective effort of all the governments since 1999. "INS Vikrant is a huge achievement but it was started 22 years ago. First Vajpayee govt, then Manmohan govt and then Modi govt, there is continuity," said Congress' Jairam Ramesh.

191.title: Around 50% rape charges in Rajasthan false: CM Ashok Gehlot
191.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that around 50% of the rape charges in the state are false. The high numbers are due to compulsory registration of FIRs in every case, he added. "The crime in Rajasthan is very less compared to other states...we have corrected that environment," he further said. "Most of the time perpetrators are girl's relatives...family," Gehlot stated.

192.title: Several birds die due to tree felling in Kerala; video surfaces
192.article_body: The Kerala Forests Department has taken legal action against a contractor after the alleged felling of a tree to widen the National Highway in Malappuram caused the deaths of several newly-hatched birds and damaged multiple eggs. A video of the incident has surfaced online, which purportedly shows the tree being felled and the birds lying dead on road.

193.title: Delhi saw a jump in hit-and-run cases in 2021: Report
193.article_body: Delhi witnessed a rise in hit-and-run cases in 2021, a transport department report said. According to the report, hit-and-run cases accounted for 59% of the total fatal road accidents in the national capital in 2021, as compared to 51% in 2020. Out of the total victims of hit-and-run crashes in 2021, the majority belonged to the 25-29 age group (95).

194.title: Pan-India films is useless debate, we just want to tell stories: Huma
194.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi stated that the debate about pan-India films is useless, adding that artists just want to be a part of films and tell entertaining stories. Huma further said she doesn't believe in the debate. "It's a great time to be an actor, you can explore so much and not just for OTT...The world is your oyster," she added.

195.title: GHMC provides mobile pond service for immersion of Ganesh idols
195.article_body: As a part of Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) along with the Freedom Group is providing mobile pond service for immersion of Ganesh idols. The mobile immersion vehicles were inaugurated by Telangana Minister Talasani Srinivas Yadav on Friday. On Thursday, as many as 74 immersion sites were prepared by GHMC for immersion of Ganesh idols.

196.title: Tamil actress Mahalakshmi marries filmmaker Ravindar Chandrasekaran
196.article_body: Tamil actress Mahalakshmi got married to Tamil filmmaker-actor Ravindar Chandrasekaran on Thursday in a traditional ceremony attended by their family and close friends. The ceremony was held at Tirumala Tirupati in Andhra Pradesh. The couple shared pictures from the ceremony on their respective social media accounts. Ravindar also shared a short video of their wedding ceremony from his account.

197.title: Top seed Swiatek beats 2017 champion Stephens to enter US Open 3rd round
197.article_body: Top seed Iga Swiatek defeated 2017 champion Sloane Stephens 6-3, 6-2 in the second round at US Open 2022 on Thursday. The world number one beat the American for the second time in three weeks to reach the third round. Swiatek has reached the round of 32 for a third consecutive year. She won the match in 74 minutes.

198.title: BMC makes 162 artificial ponds for immersion of Ganesh idols in Mumbai
198.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said it has made 162 artificial ponds for immersion of Ganesh idols in Mumbai, adding 73 natural immersion sites are available. This comes after the civic body asked devotees to immerse idols made of Plaster of Paris (PoP) in artificial lakes to reduce pollution. According to BMC, 22,687 idols were immersed in Mumbai on Thursday.

199.title: FIRs to be filed against Ganesh mandals using illegal electricity
199.article_body: The state government has decided to file FIRs against Ganesh mandals who are using illegal electricity connections for their pandals,  MSEDCL officials have warned. According to reports, only 30 mandals have requested a connection in Pimpri Chinchwad, and most of others are using unauthorised electricity sources. Authorities had requested the mandals to obtain temporary connections earlier.

200.title: Centre spent ₹5 lakh crore on MGNREGA scheme in 8 yrs: Sitharaman
200.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government spent ₹5 lakh crore on MGNREGA scheme in the past eight years, of which 20% was spent during the COVID-19 pandemic. The government had said in the Budget announcement in February that it was targeting lower-than-expected outgo for subsidy, MGNREGA and Finance Commission transfers to states, through which ₹1.88 lakh crore was saved.

201.title: I've made a living selling guilty pleasures: Karan Johar on 'Fabulous Lives...'
201.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, who produces the reality show 'The Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives', has called it a guilty pleasure. He further said, "I have made a living selling guilty pleasures." The first season of the series released in 2020 and features the professional and personal lives of star wives Neelam Kothari, Bhavana Pandey, Seema Kiran Sajdeh and Maheep Kapoor.

202.title: Will force Aamir, Big B to watch The Rings of Power: 'Thugs...' co-star Lloyd
202.article_body: Lloyd Owen, when asked if he's planning to show 'The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power' to his 'Thugs of Hindostan' co-stars Aamir Khan and Amitabh Bachchan, said, "I'll force everyone in the team to watch it." The British actor played the role of John Clive in the 2018 film, which was directed by Vijay Krishna Acharya.

203.title: Getting asset management company licence in India is hard: Zerodha CEO
203.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath told Moneycontrol that "getting an asset management company (AMC) licence in this country is quite hard". Zerodha is awaiting final approval from market regulator SEBI to set up its AMC business. While he refused to predict the market in the near or the long term, Kamath said India will continue to outperform other markets.

204.title: Gujarat woman throws her 3 kids in canal, then jumps in it with lover
204.article_body: A woman threw her three children into a canal in Gujarat and is believed to have jumped in the same canal with her lover, reports said. Chandhar village's former Sarpanch said that villagers saw bodies of two children floating in the canal. Meanwhile, cell phones were also found. The bodies of all three children have been recovered, he added.

205.title: Mumbai mobile shop owner held for dealing in stolen phones, 27 phones seized
205.article_body: A 22-year-old mobile shop owner, Zameer Hasan Sameer Sayyed, was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly dealing in stolen mobile phones. Sayyed was arrested from his house in Govandi and 27 mobile phones worth ₹4.82 lakh were seized from his shop, police said. Sayyed's role was identified while investigating a mobile snatching case that took place on August 25, police added.

206.title: Buy £20 kettle to save £10 in electricity bills a year: UK PM to citizens
206.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has been criticised on social media for suggesting citizens to buy a £20 (₹1,846) kettle to save £10 (₹923) in electricity bills over the next 12 months. "This is the best the PM of this country can come up with?" a user said. The UK is currently experiencing a cost-of-living crisis, which is likely to worsen.

207.title: 2 arrested for blackmailing girl using obscene video in Srinagar
207.article_body: Two boys have been arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar for allegedly blackmailing a girl using an obscene video of her. According to police, the two extorted money from the girl from time to time by threatening to circulate the video through WhatsApp. Subsequently, they shared the video with some Shunglipora residents, added police.

208.title: Hyderabad man sentenced to 2 years in jail for abducting minor
208.article_body: A local court in Hyderabad on Thursday reportedly sentenced a man, Namala Babu, to two years in jail for abducting a 17-year-old girl in December 2020. The minor girl went missing while returning from the shop where she was employed. The police traced the victim and based on her statement, sections under POCSO Act and Juvenile Justice Act were added.

209.title: Ex-Sri Lanka Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa allowed to travel abroad
209.article_body: Sri Lanka's highest court has temporarily lifted the overseas travel ban imposed on former Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa, the country's anti-corruption body said. He has been ordered to return by January 15, 2023. Basil's brother ex-Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa had fled the country in July amid mass protests. The Rajapaksa family is blamed for Sri Lanka's economic crisis.

210.title: Sidharth's family holds prayer meet for actor ahead of his death anniversary
210.article_body: Late actor Sidharth Shukla's family held a prayer meet with the Brahma Kumaris on the eve of his first death anniversary. The actor died of a reported heart attack aged 40 last year. In a picture that has surfaced online, his family can be seen posing with the Brahma Kumaris. Another photo showed prasad being distributed among people.

211.title: 5-yr-old dies at MP govt hospital, family alleges no treatment was offered
211.article_body: The family of a five-year-old boy who died at a Primary Health Centre in Madhya Pradesh alleged that lack of treatment was the cause of his death. Reports said that a senior government official, however, claimed the child had been brought dead to the PHC. Video of a woman sitting on ground with the boy in lap had gone viral.

212.title: Markets end flat with Sensex over 58,800 points, Nifty at 17,539
212.article_body: Benchmark indices ended on a flat note on Friday. Sensex closed 36.74 points higher at 58,803.33, while Nifty lost 3.30 points to 17,539.50. BPCL, Shree Cements, Hero MotoCorp, Hindalco Industries and ONGC were among the major Nifty losers, while stocks of HDFC, ITC, Adani Ports, Larsen and Toubro and HDFC Bank gained. The capital goods index rose by 1%.

213.title: Amber seemed to f*ck with Johnny's head again after his mom's death: Doug
213.article_body: Johnny Depp's friend Doug Stanhope has called the former's ex-wife Amber Heard a "relentlessly scheming and insulting opportunist" in his book 'No Encore for the Donkey'. He further wrote that after Johnny's mother passed away in 2016, Amber "seemed to be f*cking with his head again...using this opportunity of his weakness to manipulate him even more and harder".

214.title: India's campaign ends at Japan Open 2022 with Prannoy's loss in quarters
214.article_body: Indian shuttler HS Prannoy lost in the men's singles quarter-final against Chou Tien Chen of Chinese Taipei at Japan Open on Friday. The World Championships 2022 bronze medallist beat Prannoy 21-17, 15-21, 22-20 in one hour and 21 minutes. With this, India's campaign has ended at the tournament. Earlier, India's Kidambi Srikanth lost in the pre-quarterfinal.

215.title: 12 people booked for car fraud worth ₹86.8 lakh in Navi Mumbai
215.article_body: Navi Mumbai's Kharghar Police have booked 12 people, including the General Manager of a car showroom, for fraud worth ₹86.8 lakh. The accused GM allegedly never delivered the booked expensive cars to the customers, police said. Later, he would allegedly make a booking in another customer's name for a vehicle of less value and pocket the difference, police added.

216.title: Man pours hand sanitiser on wife, sets her on fire in Odisha
216.article_body: A 25-year-old woman is battling for life after her husband allegedly poured hand sanitiser on her and set her on fire in Odisha's Ganjam on Thursday. The man had apparently done so after failing to push his wife off of their house's terrace. Reportedly, the woman's family had given ₹1.7 lakh as dowry but her in-laws were demanding more money.

217.title: UP man elopes with girlfriend, stabs her; flees with cash, jewellery
217.article_body: A man, who eloped with his 22-year-old girlfriend, stabbed her and fled along with her cash and jewellery in Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi, police said. The victim was critically injured and has been admitted to a hospital. The victim claimed that she had been in a relationship with the accused and he had promised to marry her, police stated.

218.title: 6-year-old girl mauled by pitbull in Ghaziabad
218.article_body: A six-year-old girl was reportedly mauled by a pitbull in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. The girl was playing in a local park on August 15 when the incident happened. Her father said she sustained severe injuries in one of her ears that will require treatment for over two years. He has also filed a complaint against the dog owner.

219.title: Twitter banned over 45,000 accounts in India in July for violating guidelines
219.article_body: In its monthly compliance report released on Friday, Twitter said it banned 45,191 Indian users' accounts in July for violating its guidelines. Of these, 42,825 accounts were blocked for promoting child sexual exploitation and non-consensual nudity, while another 2,366 accounts were blocked for promoting terrorism. In June, Twitter banned over 43,000 Indian accounts.

220.title: Traffic police staff clears choked drain with bare hands in B'luru
220.article_body: A traffic police staff recently cleared a choked drain on a waterlogged road near Bengaluru's Echo World area with his bare hands. Sharing the video of the incident, HAL Airport Traffic Police Station tweeted, "Our officer Ms Nagamani and staff Mr Bheemashi clearing the waterlogging." A Twitter user commented, "That's not his job...He can't clear gutter with his bare hands!"

221.title: Work is something we do, not who we are: Tata's manager on 18-hr workday debate
221.article_body: Ratan Tata's General Manager Shantanu Naidu commented on the 18-hour workday debate, after Bombay Shaving Company's CEO Shantanu Deshpande advised freshers to work for 18 hours a day. "'Work is something we do, not who we are' is something I heard...I really believe in that," said Naidu. "In the end, it's more...[about]...what we leave behind for other people," he added.

222.title: K'taka seer complains of uneasiness day after arrest in sexual abuse case
222.article_body: Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, the head seer of Murugha Mutt in Karnataka's Chitradurga district who was arrested on Thursday for allegedly sexually abusing high school girls, complained of uneasiness on Friday, after he was sent to jail in the case. Reports said that he was taken to a hospital. Police said that the accused was questioned in the case.

223.title: So happy for 3 of you: Sushmita on brother Rajeev, Charu calling off divorce
223.article_body: After Rajeev Sen and Charu Asopa announced their decision to call off their divorce on social media, the former's sister actress Sushmita Sen took to the comment section to react. She wrote, "I am soooooo happy for all 3 of you!!! Dugga Dugga Shona." Charu had earlier said that her sister-in-law Sushmita has been a "huge emotional support".

224.title: PM inaugurates mechanisation, industrialisation projects worth ₹3800 cr in Mangaluru
224.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated and laid the foundation stone of mechanisation and industrialisation projects worth ₹3800 crore in Mangaluru. "New India is the land of new opportunities...These projects will help in strengthening trade and commerce with an increase in ease of doing business," he said. He also spoke about India's vision of "Green Growth".

225.title: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma spending ₹19 crore for farmhouse in Alibaug: Reports
225.article_body: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma are spending ₹19.24 crore for a farmhouse that will be set up on 8 acres of land in Alibaug, according to reports. A deposit of ₹1.15 crore has been made to the government treasury, the reports added. Virat's brother Vikas Kohli reportedly completed the transaction on Tuesday, the day before Ganesh Chaturthi.

226.title: There's no financial 'security' for NZ cricketers: NZ pacer McClenaghan
226.article_body: Following New Zealand cricketer Trent Boult's decision to give up his central contract, New Zealand pacer Mitchell McClenaghan said, "There's...no [financial] security at all [for our players]." "You're not an employee...You could lose your job tomorrow so...your security's out of the window," added McClenaghan. "Once you're at a certain age, you're not...valued at New Zealand Cricket," he stated.

227.title: Pictures of influencer Aashita Singh go viral, people call her Aishwarya Rai's lookalike
227.article_body: Pictures of Aashita Singh have gone viral, with several social media users calling her Aishwarya Rai's lookalike. Aashita, who describes herself as an artist in her Instagram bio, has over 2.5 lakh followers. "Looking like Aishwarya Rai," an Instagram user commented on one of her posts, while another comment read, "Aishwarya pro max."

228.title: England announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
228.article_body: England have announced their squad for the men's T20 World Cup 2022. The 15-member squad will be led by Jos Buttler. The team includes five players from the Yorkshire county. Further, fast bowlers Chris Woakes and Mark Wood, who last played for England in March, have recovered from their respective injuries and have been included in the squad.

229.title: Kalyan Chaubey elected new AIFF President, beats Bhaichung Bhutia 33-1
229.article_body: Former Indian footballer Kalyan Chaubey has been elected the new All India Football Federation President. He defeated Bhaichung Bhutia as general secretaries of 33 state football federations voted for him, while Bhutia received just one vote. The elections were first scheduled for December 2020 but were delayed due to multiple factors including delay in drafting the AIFF constitution.

230.title: 7-8 of our first 10 employees are still with us: Bombay Shaving Company CEO
230.article_body: Bombay Shaving Company's CEO Shantanu Deshpande told ET NOW that out of the first 10 employees, seven to eight of them are still working at the startup. Deshpande was recently criticised for advising freshers to work 18 hours a day. "Feel free to come any time," he earlier said to people wondering about the work culture at Bombay Shaving Company.

231.title: Pics show chaos, passengers' protest at Delhi airport after Lufthansa cancels flights
231.article_body: Over 700 passengers inside Delhi airport and 200 of their relatives outside Terminal-3 staged a protest late on Thursday night after German carrier Lufthansa informed it is cancelling its flights on Friday due to pilots' strike. "Two flights to Munich and Frankfurt with around 400 passengers were cancelled without intimation...Situation was diffused," police said.

232.title: 'Serial killer Stoneman' arrested after sketch released by Madhya Pradesh police
232.article_body: An assailant dubbed "Stoneman" by Madhya Pradesh police officers has been arrested after his sketch was released. The man suspected to be involved in the killings of three security guards in Sagar town was arrested from Bhopal. The deceased guards had their heads smashed in separate incidents earlier this week.

233.title: SC rejects plea to declare Sanskrit as national language
233.article_body: The Supreme Court dismissed a plea seeking to declare Sanskrit as the national language. The court said it was a policy decision which requires an amendment to the Constitution. "We cannot issue a writ to the Centre to take a particular policy decision," it added. The bench asked the petitioner, a lawyer, if he could speak one line in Sanskrit.

234.title: Armaan Kohli languishing in jail, bail order pending before HC: Lawyer
234.article_body: The lawyer of actor Armaan Kohli, who was arrested last year by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in a drugs case, has stated that the actor is "languishing" in jail. He said that Armaan's bail order is pending before the High Court as the judge is in Nagpur. NCB officials had allegedly recovered 1.2 grams of cocaine from his residence.

235.title: Used to listen to cricket commentary under covers as a kid: Big B
235.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan on his television game show 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' has revealed that he used to go under the covers of his bed to listen to cricket commentary on the transistor as a child. He added that when his mother Teji Bachchan caught him, she questioned him and asked him to focus on his studies.

236.title: There's a difference between criticism & bullying: Erica J Fernandes
236.article_body: Actress-model Erica J Fernandes in an interview spoke about trolling faced by those in the industry, saying there is a difference between structural criticism and trolling and bullying. Erica was earlier trolled for sporting a Viking look at an award show red carpet. "It's ironic how I was getting trolled for following a theme set by the organisers," she added.

237.title: Google pledges $20 mn to boost computer science education in US
237.article_body: Google has pledged $20 million to make computer science (CS) education accessible to more than 11 million underserved students in the US. The funds will be given to organisations, including Oakland-based Hidden Genius Project, that work with major urban centers and rural communities. Google said the pledge brings its total commitment to CS education to over $240 million since 2004.

238.title: I am 'still worried' about Virat Kohli's lack of fluency: Jaffer
238.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said Team India will be in "trouble" if somebody's not batting at a strike rate of 140 or 150 alongside Kohli. "You've got to have somebody who's batting...at a much higher strike rate...I'm still worried about Kohli's fluency...If Suryakumar Yadav [hadn't fired] (against Hong Kong), India would've scored 150," added Jaffer.

239.title: Jharkhand heading towards becoming a separate Islamic nation: BJP MP
239.article_body: Amid political crisis in Jharkhand, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey claimed that the state is moving towards becoming a separate Islamic nation. "The way the pro-Pakistan forces are active, it is only the vote bank politics...The government is moving towards the creation of a new country...After Pakistan, Jharkhand will be a place which will merge with Bangladesh," said the MP.

240.title: Clashes erupt as Cong workers try to obstruct Sitharaman's convoy in T'gana
240.article_body: Youth Congress workers clashed with BJP members and the police as they tried to obstruct Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's convoy during her visit to Kamareddy district in Telangana on Friday. Workers of both parties were injured in the incident. The incident occurred during Sitharaman's visit to Zaheerabad parliamentary constituency for the BJP's Parliament Pravas Yojana.

241.title: Maruti Suzuki India reports 26% surge in total sales in August
241.article_body: Maruti Suzuki India reported a 26.37% surge in total sales at 1,65,173 units in August as against 1,30,699 units in the corresponding month last year. The domestic passenger vehicle sales saw a 30% growth, while that of the mini segment cars grew to 22,162 units as against 20,461 units in August 2021. Sales of compact cars clocked a 57% surge.

242.title: 9 arrested for looting steel rods from warehouse near Thane
242.article_body: The Mira-Bhayandar, Vasai-Virar Police have arrested nine people for allegedly stealing steel rods worth nearly ₹4 lakh from a company's warehouse on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway at Pelhar, Thane. The accused were arrested from various districts of Maharashtra and most of them are already booked in multiple cases, police said. The Mumbai Police also assisted in the operation.

243.title: Kerala shops can't sell shawarma without licence, fine up to ₹5 lakh
243.article_body: Shops in Kerala must have a licence to sell shawarma, according to the government's new rules. Those found in violation could be punished with a fine up to ₹5 lakh and imprisonment up to 6 months. As per the new rules, chicken used in the shawarma must be cooked for 15 minutes and beef for 30 minutes.

244.title: B'luru was neglected by previous govts: K'taka CM on floods in city
244.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday blamed the negligence of previous state governments for recent floods in Bengaluru. "For the past eight-ten years, Bengaluru was completely neglected," he added. He claimed that ₹800 crore, which was spent by the civic body on remodelling of drains, wasn't utilised properly and that builders have encroached upon drains in the last 15 years.

245.title: Stones hurled at houses in Ghaziabad, locals 'stop stepping out'
245.article_body: Residents have said that people have "stopped stepping out" of their homes after unidentified individuals started regularly hurling stones and other materials at houses in Ghaziabad's Ashok Nagar A block. The stone pelting reportedly began on Monday and police said that they will now use drones to trace the suspects. "Police personnel have been...[on] lookout...but are clueless," a resident said.

246.title: SC issues notice to Centre on population control plea
246.article_body: The Supreme Court issued notice to the Centre on a plea seeking direction to the government to frame rules and guidelines to tackle the overpopulation issue. The plea said that overpopulation is one of the most significant factors giving rise to several serious problems. It also sought direction to declare the first Sunday of every month as Health Day.

247.title: 2 minors electrocuted at Ganesh Chaturthi fair in Greater Noida, 1 dies
247.article_body: At least one boy, aged 12, died after he and another boy, aged three, were electrocuted at a Ganesh Chaturthi fair in Greater Noida on Thursday, police said. The victims were descending from an iron ladder after getting off a swing, police added. The two boys were on a 'train ride' when the incident happened, police stated.

248.title: Pune, Jalgaon report 10 deaths due to lumpy skin disease
248.article_body: At least 762 cases of lumpy skin disease across 10 districts in Maharashtra have been reported. Moreover, 10 deaths have been recorded due to the disease across Pune and Jalgaon districts. Owing to the rising cases, officials from the animal husbandry department have decided to ban all interstate transport of cattle, including cows and buffaloes.

249.title: Mysterious pneumonia kills three people in Argentina
249.article_body: Three people have died from a type of pneumonia of unknown origin in Argentina's Tucuman province, authorities said. Another six have been infected with the mysterious respiratory illness, Tucuman Health Minister Luis Medina Ruiz said. All the cases so far are connected to one health clinic. The medical facility has been placed in preventive isolation for seven days.

250.title: S Korea, US, Japan to respond jointly if N Korea conducts 7th nuclear test
250.article_body: The US, South Korea and Japan will respond jointly if North Korea conducts its seventh nuclear test, South Korea's National Security Adviser said after a meeting with his US and Japanese counterparts. "Our three countries together with the international community will maximise cooperation in a way that [North Korea] realises it was a clearly wrong choice," Kim Sung-han added.

251.title: I-T Dept raids Kolkata-based firm, finds ₹250 cr unaccounted income
251.article_body: The Income Tax Department had in August raided the premises of a Kolkata-based company that manufactures power transmission and distribution structures, among other things. The Finance Ministry said the raid and seizure covered 28 premises in West Bengal and Jharkhand. Various pieces of evidence related to alleged tax evasion, fraud and unaccounted income of over ₹250 crore were unearthed.

252.title: Used to listen to cricket commentary under covers as a kid: Big B
252.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan on his television game show 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' has revealed that he used to go under the covers of his bed to listen to cricket commentary on the transistor as a child. He added that when his mother Teji Bachchan caught him, she questioned him and asked him to focus on his studies.

272.title: Apple settles lawsuit with Pinterest ex-engineer over 'unfair' rejection of app
272.article_body: Apple has settled a lawsuit with app developer and former Pinterest engineer Kosta Eleftheriou, who had alleged that his own app had been unfairly rejected by App Store and then later targeted by scammers. Eleftheriou had claimed App Store rejected his FlickType Apple Watch keyboard app, but approved competitor keyboard apps and others that used integrated version of FlickType keyboard.
