The domestic passenger vehicle sales saw a 30% growth, while that of the mini segment cars grew to 22,162 units as against 20,461 units in August 2021. Sales of compact cars clocked a 57% surge.

276.title: Tree falls, punctures gas & water pipelines in Pune; triggers leak
276.article_body: A tree fell in Pune's Bibvewadi and punctured the Maharashtra Natural Gas Limited (MNGL) and water pipelines, causing gas to seep into the water pipeline on Thursday. Initially, a request was sent to the electricity board to shut the power in the area, following which MNGL and water supply workers repaired both pipelines and the fire department cleared the tree.

277.title: Colombia to give properties confiscated from drug groups to farmers, women
277.article_body: Colombian President Gustavo Petro on Thursday said that Colombia would donate properties seized from drug trafficking groups to farmers, women's organisations, youth collectives and universities. The seized properties are worth around $4.9 billion, he added. Petro, who was elected in June, has promised ambitious social programs he says will begin to right centuries of injustice in Colombia.

278.title: Kyrgios handed biggest fine of US Open 2022 of ₹6 lakh for spitting at his team, abusing
278.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios has been handed the biggest fine of US Open 2022 of $7,500 (₹6 lakh) for spitting at his team and abusing during his second round match against Benjamin Bonzi. The 27-year-old swore and spat in the direction of team. "Go home if you are not going to f***ing support me bro," he was heard saying.

279.title: Padma Shri awardee Kamala Pujari forced to dance inside ICU before being discharged
279.article_body: A social worker allegedly forced Padma Shri awardee Kamala Pujari to dance inside a hospital in Odisha's Cuttack before she was discharged. Pujari had been admitted to the hospital over a kidney ailment. Odisha's Paraja tribal community, to which the Padma Shri awardee belongs, has sought action against the social worker for making her dance in the ICU.

280.title: 'Dissatisfied' Norwegian Tesla owners go on hunger strike, list 29 issues
280.article_body: Some "dissatisfied" Tesla owners in Norway have gone on a hunger strike and listed 29 issues they have been facing with their cars on a website in an attempt to make their complaints known to Elon Musk. "Elon Musk, please help us," reads their website. "We believe...if...Musk is made aware...he will solve the situation," the group wrote.

281.title: US pilot threatens to cancel take off after passenger AirDrops nudes to others
281.article_body: A video of a Southwest Airlines pilot threatening to cancel take off from Houston, US, after a person on the plane sent nude photographs to other passengers has surfaced online. "If this continues while we're on the ground, I'm going to have to pull back to the gate...quit sending naked pictures," the pilot could be heard saying in the video.

282.title: We don't take any such requests: Swiggy as user says 'Don't want Muslim delivery person'
282.article_body: Swiggy has responded after a customer mentioned "Don't want a Muslim delivery person" in the instructions while placing an order. "There is no place for discrimination in Swiggy's delivery universe. The assignment of orders is entirely automated and doesn't take any such requests," Swiggy tweeted. Swiggy's response came after TMC leader Mahua Moitra shared a screenshot of customer's demand.

283.title: Cruise recalls and updates software in robotaxis after crash in US
283.article_body: General Motors' autonomous vehicle unit Cruise recalled and updated software in 80 self-driving cars following a crash in June in San Francisco, public filings showed. The crash, which left two people injured, involved a driverless Cruise robotaxi braking harshly while making a left turn. As per regulators, the recalled software could "incorrectly predict" an oncoming vehicle's path.

284.title: 2nd arrest made in sexual assault case involving Sri Murugha Mutt chief pontiff
284.article_body: Second arrest has been made in the sexual assault case involving Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, the chief pontiff of Sri Murugha Mutt in Karnataka. "Second accused, Rashmi [has been] arrested in matter," Chitradurga SP told news agency ANI. Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru was himself arrested on Thursday. He allegedly used to sexually abuse girls residing in a hostel run by the mutt.

285.title: Singer Bamba Bakya, known for his collaboration with AR Rahman, passes away at 49
285.article_body: Singer Bamba Bakya, known for his collaborations with AR Rahman, passed away in a hospital in Chennai at the age of 49. Bakya was hospitalised after he complained of discomfort in the chest, reports said. Bakya, who recently sang Ponni Nadhi for Mani Ratnam's Ponniyin Selvan, sang many devotional songs in his career.

286.title: Microsoft's $68 bn Activision deal could damage gaming industry: UK
286.article_body: Microsoft's $68.7 billion deal to acquire Activision Blizzard could damage the gaming industry if the Xbox video games console maker refused to give competitors access to Activision's popular games like 'Call of Duty' after the merger, the UK antitrust regulator said. It added that the deal needed to be investigated in depth. The deal is expected to close in 2023.

287.title: Kangana gave me suggestions during 'Emergency', I was mesmerised: Anupam
287.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher in an interview stated that he has done so much work in the industry that he feels what advice would someone give him now. He added that Kangana Ranaut would come to him on the sets of 'Emergency' and whisper suggestions in his ear, leaving him mesmerised. Anupam will portray Jayaprakash Narayan in the Kangana Ranaut directorial.

288.title: Randeep Hooda shares pic of physical transformation after saying he 'lost 18 kg'
288.article_body: Days after Randeep Hooda said in an interview that he has lost 18 kg for his upcoming movie 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar', the actor has shared a picture showing his physical transformation. "We all need a lift at times #prep," he wrote with the picture on Instagram. He had earlier lost weight for his role in the 2016 film 'Sarbjit'.

289.title: Any player can bat like AB de Villiers nowadays: Robin Uthappa
289.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Robin Uthappa said every batter has become a 360-degree player with the game's evolution. "Any player can bat like AB de Villiers," he added. "Even Rohit Sharma has started...playing...unorthodox shots...In the past, every time he's been captain, he's probably found himself in a place where he's been...more circumspect than he...[was] when he wasn't the captain," he stated.

290.title: Trump & his supporters are threat to democracy: US Prez Biden
290.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday said that ex-President Donald Trump and his "Make America Great Again" (MAGA) supporters are a "threat to democracy". "MAGA forces are determined to take this country backwards. Backwards to an America where there's no right to choose, no right to privacy, no right to contraception, no right to marry who you love," he added.

291.title: NGT fines 2 persons ₹36 crore for illegal sand mining in Odisha
291.article_body: National Green Tribunal (NGT) has imposed a penalty of around ₹36 crore on two persons involved in illegally and excessively mining sand from a riverbed in Odisha. The penalty is reportedly amongst the highest imposed on individuals over illegal mining. The bench also expressed dissatisfaction over the lack of action taken against the tehsildar who allegedly colluded with the duo.

292.title: INS Vikrant not a mere war machine but proof of India's skill, talent: PM
292.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that INS Vikrant is an example of the Indian government's thrust to make its defence sector self-reliant. "INS Vikrant is not a mere war machine but proof of India's skill and talent. It is special, different," he added. He also highlighted the indigenisation efforts behind the ship.

293.title: My validation for films is box office, not praise: Tiger Shroff
293.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff during his appearance on talk show 'Koffee With Karan' said that he is even hungrier now for box office numbers. The actor added that he is not the kind of actor to enjoy adulation via praise for his performance. "My validation is the box office. I live for those... whistles...when I land and...save the day," he said.

294.title: Ganguly said, 'They've scored, so will we': Kaif on 2002 NatWest final
294.article_body: Discussing the 2002 NatWest final where India beat England after chasing down 326, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said, "We were nervous...Our bowlers were disappointed." "Conceding 325...those days...I remember...[ex-India coach] John Wright's face. He was extremely restless," added Kaif. "Fifteen minutes before the chase...Sourav Ganguly called us and said, 'They've scored...so will we'."

295.title: Shopify told to pay $40 mn for infringing web tech patents in US
295.article_body: A Delaware jury has told Shopify to pay $40 million to Express Mobile for infringing three patents related to mobile-website technology. The e-commerce company's argument that the patents were invalid was rejected by the jury. California-based Express Mobile has sued several technology companies, including Google, Meta and Amazon, for allegedly infringing the same and other patents.

296.title: Massive fire at Haryana's Panchkula Sector 9 market; 148 shops gutted
296.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a market in Sector 9 in Haryana's Panchkula on Thursday. As many as 148 shops were gutted, however, there were no reports of casualties. "The fire spread from the roof...firefighters were controlling the blaze...but were unaware that combustible material was placed on the rooftop of one of the shops," an official said.

297.title: Secret coded messages sent to Sri Lanka players from dressing room, pics go viral
297.article_body: During Sri Lanka-Bangladesh match in Asia Cup 2022, Sri Lanka team management sent secret coded messages to Sri Lankan players from the team's dressing room. A series of numbers and letters like '2D' and 'D5' were seen being flashed to the players. "There's no rocket science, a lot of teams are doing it," Sri Lanka head coach Chris Silverwood said.

298.title: How much salary will Starbucks' next CEO Laxman Narasimhan receive?
298.article_body: India-born Laxman Narasimhan will receive $1.3 million in annual base salary as the next CEO of Starbucks. The 55-year-old executive will get a cash signing bonus of $1.6 million and up to $9.25 million to make up for incentives he's forfeiting by leaving Reckitt Benckiser. Starting 2023, Narasimhan will be eligible for annual equity awards worth up to $13.6 million.

299.title: Assam to bring back elephant being allegedly tortured in TN temple
299.article_body: The Assam government on Thursday decided to send a four-member team to investigate and bring back a captive elephant, named 'Joymala', that is allegedly being tortured at a temple in Tamil Nadu. Earlier, PETA India had shared a purported video of the elephant being assaulted with pliers. "The team will visit Tamil Nadu on September 2," Assam CM tweeted.

300.title: Ford recalls 198,000 SUVs in US after reports of 25 fires
300.article_body: Ford has recalled 198,000 SUVs in the US as their heating and cooling fan motors can potentially fail, increasing the risk of a vehicle interior fire. The company said it has received 25 fire reports related to the front blower motor, including one involving minor injury. The recall covers certain 2015-2017 model year Ford Expedition and Lincoln Navigator vehicles.

301.title: Audi launches the all-new Audi Q3
301.article_body: Audi invites customers to experience life beyond ordinary with the new Audi Q3. It's a family car with many talents that exudes sophistication and exuberance with its presence, so that customers face adventure head-on, Audi said, adding that it has the quintessential quattro all-wheel drive with the best-in-class leg room. It is available in 5 paint ﬁnishes, including pulse orange.

302.title: Improve your strength & stamina with Surge MAX supplement: mars by GHC
302.article_body: mars by GHC, an energy and power supplement brand, has announced a special salary day sale. Almost 63% of men experience a loss of desire and strength due to low levels of testosterone, the brand shared. Adding Surge MAX containing shilajit, ashwagandha, safed musli and gokshura in your daily routine can help improve your strength and stamina, it stated.

303.title: Ex-Myanmar leader Suu Kyi found guilty of electoral fraud, jailed for 3 years: Report
303.article_body: Former Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi was found guilty of electoral fraud on Friday and sentenced by a judge to three years in jail with hard labour, according to a Reuters report quoting a source. The Nobel laureate, who has been detained since a coup in February 2021, has already been sentenced to more than 17 years in prison.

304.title: Boycott culture in Bollywood is a fashion nowadays: Chandrachur Singh
304.article_body: Actor Chandrachur Singh has stated that boycott culture in Bollywood is a fashion nowadays, adding that if a film is strong, there is no way it won't connect with the audience. "I got to know more about the boycott trends only during interviews...I don't look at what people say, I look at how the product will be received," he said.

305.title: 7, including 5 children, killed as boat capsizes in UP's Ghazipur
305.article_body: Seven persons, including five children, were killed in the Athota village of UP's Ghazipur district after a boat carrying 17 people capsized on Wednesday. "Ten people were rescued by the divers with the help of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and all the bodies have been recovered," Ghazipur ADM Arun Kumar Singh said.

306.title: I know which films do well and which don't, but don't keep track: Mouni
306.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy has stated that she hasn't worked enough in films to have an understanding of what really happens but is "an aware person". "I get to know which film did well and which didn't but I am not somebody who keeps...track," the actress added. The actress will be seen portraying the antagonist in 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva'.

307.title: ₹869 crore distributed to farmers under KALIA scheme in Odisha
307.article_body: Under the Krushak Assistance for Livelihood and Income Augmentation (KALIA) scheme, Odisha government distributed financial aid of ₹869 crore to 41 lakh small farmers and  85,000 landless farmers. "More than ₹800 crore was provided to our farmer brothers even on Akshaya Tritiya in May. I hope this assistance would enable them to carry out their farming duties," said Odisha CM.

308.title: Migrant labourer from West Bengal shot in J&K's Pulwama
308.article_body: A migrant labourer from West Bengal was shot by terrorists in the Pulwama district of Jammu and Kashmir, said police on Friday. The victim, identified as Muneerul Islam, was rushed to a hospital where his condition was said to be stable. The area where the shooting occurred has been cordoned off, Kashmir Zone Police said in a tweet.

309.title: Masturbating in public infers sexual intent: Mumbai court on convicting 60-yr-old man
309.article_body: Convicting a 60-year-old man in child sex abuse case, a Mumbai court observed that masturbating in presence of another person is sufficient to infer sexual intent. A four-year-old boy had seen the convict masturbating in his tailoring shop. The court held that any passer-by could have seen his act, hence it cannot be said that he was masturbating in private.

310.title: 17 Indian citizens apprehended while illegally crossing into US
310.article_body: Seventeen Indian citizens were among a group of 100 migrants apprehended while illegally climbing over a fence into the US at a border post in California, authorities said. The San Diego Sector Border Patrol agents apprehended the migrants at around 2 am on Tuesday morning. Over 1,45,600 migrants have been apprehended in the 2022 fiscal year in San Diego Sector.

311.title: Man tries to shoot Argentina Vice President Cristina on camera; gun malfunctions
311.article_body: Argentina's Vice President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner was unharmed on Thursday when a man with a loaded gun tried to shoot her but the gun did not go off, officials said. The video of the incident has surfaced on social media. "This is the most serious event we have gone through since Argentina returned to democracy," President Alberto Fernandez said.

312.title: Shiv Sena MP seeks suspension of MNS workers for assaulting woman
312.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi criticised MNS and demanded suspension of workers who were seen abusing and assaulting an elderly woman in Maharashtra. "It's totally unacceptable and shameful behaviour. It's not Maharashtra's culture. He (MNS leader) should publicly apologise to all the women of Maharashtra. I urge MNS chief...to suspend the accused from all party posts," said Priyanka.

313.title: 170-km-long Pune Ring Road project to begin after monsoon
313.article_body: The 170-kilometre-long Pune Ring Road project is set to begin after the monsoon, Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) said. The Ring Road will connect the six national roads that pass through the Pune Metropolitan Region. The road is expected to improve transit and reduce pollution. Tenders have been floated for the first 32-kilometre section.

314.title: Google to extend third-party in-app billing pilot to India
314.article_body: Google is extending its third-party in-app billing pilot programme to India, Australia, Indonesia, Japan and the European Economic Area. The programme will enable developers to offer an additional billing system along with that of Google Play. The development comes amid Google facing scrutiny over the business practices of its apps marketplace. The programme was introduced in March 2022.

315.title: Advocate seeks CBI probe into Sonali Phogat death case
315.article_body: An advocate has written a letter to the Chief Justice of India (CJI) UU Lalit, seeking transfer of the Sonali Phogat death case to the CBI. "[I appeal to the court] to transfer the investigation...from Goa Police to CBI to find out if there is a larger conspiracy behind the killing," the lawyer urged in his letter.

316.title: People protest outside Delhi airport after Lufthansa cancels flights
316.article_body: After Lufthansa cancelled two flights bound to Frankfurt and Munich, people protested on the main road in front of the departure gate at Terminal 3 of Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport demanding a refund or alternate flights, early on Friday. The German airline cancelled 800 passenger and cargo flights on Friday after the pilots union announced a planned all-day strike.

317.title: Jailed Meghalaya BJP leader Bernard N Marak arrested in 3rd case
317.article_body: BJP's Meghalaya vice-president Bernard N Marak, who is in jail, has been arrested in a third case, police said. He was remanded to five days of police custody on Wednesday. Marak, who has been jailed in connection with two cases including one of running a sex racket from his farmhouse, has now been charged with extortion, cheating and forgery.

318.title: US rail company's one-word 'Trains' tweet starts viral Twitter trend
318.article_body: A one-word tweet by American train service provider Amtrak started a viral Twitter trend. After Amtrak tweeted, "Trains," US President Joe Biden followed with a tweet that read, "Democracy." NASA tweeted, "Universe," while American radio organisation NPR wrote, "Radio." American daily newspaper The Washington Post also joined the trend and tweeted, "News."

319.title: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal shares interaction with former employee who is now a pilot
319.article_body: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal recently shared his interaction with a young pilot who used to work at Cairn Vedanta. "It made me happy to hear that people who have worked with us have succeeded in their careers," he said. Agarwal added, "Manzil unhi ko milti hai jinke hauslon mein jaan hoti hai (Only determined people are capable of fulfilling their dreams)."

320.title: Indian-origin CEOs' appointment at iconic firms unstoppable: Mahindra on new Starbucks CEO
320.article_body: After Starbucks named Pune-born Laxman Narasimhan as its next CEO, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "The appointment of Indian-origin CEOs at the world's most iconic companies is now an unstoppable trend." "International boardrooms consider them to be almost 'safe' leadership bets," he added. Narasimhan will join the Seattle-headquartered coffee chain as incoming CEO on October 1.

321.title: Not a great idea: Ratan Tata's manager on 18-hr workday debate
321.article_body: Commenting on the 18-hour workday controversy raked up by Bombay Shaving Company CEO Shantanu Deshpande, Ratan Tata's General Manager Shantanu Naidu said, "I think as human beings, we are worth much more than that". He added that preaching about a hustle culture "to young, impressionable minds is not a great idea". Deshpande had said, "Don't do random rona-dhona...Be relentless."

322.title: 29-year-old UP woman stages own abduction, seeks ₹10 lakh ransom
322.article_body: A 29-year-old woman from UP allegedly staged her own kidnapping and sought ₹10 lakh as ransom from her parents. Her mother, however, claimed that her abductors blackmailed her to seek the ransom. The parents had approached the police after the woman did not return home and her phone was switched off. Police found her at a friend's house in Lucknow.

323.title: Nadal hits himself with racket at US Open; pic shows him bleeding from nose
323.article_body: Rafael Nadal was seen bleeding from his nose after accidentally hitting himself with his racket during the US Open match against Italy's Fabio Fognini. Pictures and videos from the incident showed him bleeding from his nose. However, the Spaniard recorded a 2-6, 6-4, 6-2, 6-1 victory over Fognini after recovering from the injury.

324.title: Class 10 student sodomises Class 3 boy at govt school in Delhi
324.article_body: A case has been filed after a Class 3 boy was allegedly sodomised by a Class 10 student at a government school in Madhu Vihar in Delhi. The victim's father told IANS that the incident had occurred on the school premises. "My son complained to the teacher...after which the matter was reported and I was called," the father said.

325.title: Taiwan shoots down drone for first time off Chinese coast
325.article_body: Taiwan's military for the first time shot down an unidentified civilian drone that entered its airspace near an islet off the Chinese coast on Thursday. Calling it the "most appropriate" action, Taiwan Premier Su Tseng-chang said that the military acted in self-defence. The incident came after Taiwan had repeatedly complained of harassment by drones coming from China.

326.title: Today, India joins developed nations that make indigenous aircraft carriers: PM
326.article_body: While commissioning India's first indigenous aircraft carrier INS Vikrant in Kochi, PM Narendra Modi said that until now, only developed nations built such aircraft carriers. "Today, India has joined this league...taken another step towards being a developed nation," he added. "INS Vikrant is not just a warship, it's the evidence of hard work...commitment of 21st century India," PM stated.

327.title: Pune civic body demolishes unauthorised structure on waqf land
327.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) anti-encroachment department has demolished a 4,000 square feet ground and a building that had come up on waqf land. This comes after Aurangabad MP Imtiaz Jaleel tweeted pictures of the unauthorised structure and asked PMC to stop the construction. Pune Waqf Officer Khusro Khan said that a request to lodge an FIR was made to police.

328.title: I still travel in economy, go to same hotel with parents: Kartik Aaryan
328.article_body: Speaking about being relatable even after his success, actor Kartik Aaryan stated that he still travels in economy and has dreams. "I go to the same hotel with mom and dad...in Gwalior, we'll eat the same paneer and naan and that's not going to change," he added. The actor further said that his dreams are only getting bigger.

329.title: Was told 'Dil Se' got thumbs down due to tragic ending, we were panicking: RGV
329.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said that the exhibitors felt that killing Shah Rukh Khan in 'Dil Se' was a mistake. "They told us that due to the tragic ending, the viewers are giving the film thumbs down. We were all panicking," he said, adding, "Bharat Shah told me that 'Bahut gadbad ho gaya hai (We have made a huge mistake)."

330.title: It's just an online fad: Celesti on being called Alia's lookalike
330.article_body: Actress Celesti Bairagey, who went viral on social media for being actress Alia Bhatt's lookalike, has said that the tag is just an online fad. "I must also add that I really admire Alia and take inspiration from her career. What a fantastic graph she has," she added. Celesti portrays titular character Rajjo in television show 'Udti Ka Naam Rajjo'.

331.title: INS Vikrant, largest warship ever built in maritime history of India, commissioned
331.article_body: INS Vikrant, the largest and most complex warship ever built in the maritime history of India, was commissioned into the Indian Navy by PM Narendra Modi on Friday. The warship is as massive as two football fields end to end and 18 floors tall, the Navy said. The hangar of the aircraft carrier is as big as two Olympic-size pools.

332.title: Brad Hogg picks Dinesh Karthik over Rishabh Pant for T20 WC 2022
332.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg picked Dinesh Karthik over Rishabh Pant for the wicketkeeper-batter's slot for T20 World Cup 2022. "Karthik has a much better strike rate and better average...He's got a better range of shots," added Hogg. "With that high strike rate at the backend...being able to come in and hit from ball one, Karthik's definitely the man," he stated.

333.title: India reports 6,168 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 59,210
333.article_body: India has reported 6,168 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. As many as 21 patients succumbed to the coronavirus infection in the last 24 hours. The number of active cases in India now stands at 59,210 and the COVID-19 positivity rate has dropped to 1.94%.

334.title: I smile thinking of how he pulled my leg, flirted: Devoleena on Sidharth
334.article_body: Actress Devoleena Bhattacharjee has spoken about late actor Sidharth Shukla, saying that it seems just like yesterday when he passed away. The two were seen together in the reality television show 'Bigg Boss 13'. "I smile at times thinking about how he used to pull my leg, flirt with me and sing for me in that house," the actress added.

335.title: 2 kids detained for carrying pistols to school in UP's Prayagraj
335.article_body: Two children were arrested and sent to a juvenile home for carrying country-made pistols to school in separate cases in UP's Prayagraj. In the first case, a Class 8 student in Alopibagh locality was caught carrying a pistol and a live cartridge. In the second case, a pistol was recovered from a Class 10 student of a Soraon-based intermediate college.

336.title: NDTV claims stake sale needs I-T Dept's nod, Adani Group calls it 'misconceived'
336.article_body: NDTV has claimed that any stake sale by its founders to Adani Group will require clearance from the Income Tax Department as they have been barred from selling a part of their stake. Responding to this, Adani Group said the claims have "no merit" and are "misconceived". It further said such claims are attempt "to further inordinately delay" the deal.

337.title: Indian-American neurosurgeon pleads guilty to accepting ₹26 crore in bribes in US
337.article_body: An Indian-American neurosurgeon has pleaded guilty to a criminal charge for accepting $3.3 million (₹26 crore) in bribes in the US. Between 2010 and 2013, Lokesh Tantuwaya, 55, accepted bribes from the owner of a now-defunct hospital in California for performing spinal surgeries. Tantuwaya has been in federal custody since May 2021 and faces up to five years in prison.

338.title: Opposition parties would make the decision: KCR on PM face
338.article_body: Reacting on whether Bihar CM Nitish Kumar would be the Opposition's candidate for PM in 2024, Telangana CM KCR said that Opposition parties would meet and make that decision. BJP MP Sushil Modi mocked Kumar and said, "Bihar CM called KCR to seal his candidature for the post of PM. But KCR didn't even take his name."

339.title: New UK PM to face staff walk out on first day in office: Union
339.article_body: Britain's Public and Commercial Services Union (PCS) said staff working at Business and Energy Department building would begin a strike on the same day UK's new PM is named next week. Staff will walk out on September 5 and 6 over health, safety and other entitlements. The action is "a sign of things to come" for next PM, PCS added.

340.title: PM Modi unveils new ensign of Indian Navy; pic released
340.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday unveiled the new Naval Ensign (Nishaan) in Kerala's Kochi while commissioning India's first indigenous aircraft carrier INS Vikrant. The old ensign had the St George's Cross along with the Tricolour in the canton. It now includes the Indian Navy crest on a navy blue background and drew inspiration from Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

341.title: Jhulan Goswami's story was eye-opener for me: Anushka on Chakda 'Xpress
341.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma has stated that former Indian women's cricket team captain Jhulan Goswami's story was an eye-opening journey for her. The actress will be seen portraying Jhulan in the upcoming film 'Chakda 'Xpress'. Anushka is shooting in UK's Leeds for the film. This marks the actress' return to films after three years since the 2018 film 'Zero'.

342.title: Can't make decisions based on their opinions: Bipasha on trolling over baby bump
342.article_body: Reacting to the online negativity and trolling over maternity photoshoots, actress Bipasha Basu stated that everyone is entitled to an opinion and all opinions are respected. "But I'm leading my life...You can't be deciding everything...on the basis of what people want you to do or say," she added. Bipasha announced her pregnancy with husband Karan Singh Grover on August 16.

343.title: Sushil calls Nitish & KCR's meeting 'comedy show'; Nitish replies
343.article_body: After BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi called Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and his Telangana counterpart K Chandrashekar Rao's meeting the "latest comedy show of Opposition unity", Nitish reacted to it claiming that no one takes Sushil seriously, "even his party does not". "Since [Sushil] is saying something against me...every day, he may find a place...at the Centre," Nitish added.

344.title: Lord Ganesha idol in Mumbai mandal decorated with 66 kg gold, 295 kg silver
344.article_body: Lord Ganesha idol in Mumbai's GSB Seva Mandal has been decorated with 66 kg gold and 295 kg silver, Amit Pai, trustee of the GSB Seva Mandal told news agency ANI. Pai also said the gold and silver that have been used for decorating the idol has been donated by the devotees amid the ongoing festival of Ganesh Chaturthi.

345.title: No woman should go through this: Mumbai woman who was slapped by MNS leader
345.article_body: Prakash Devi, an elderly female shop owner who was slapped by MNS leader Vinod Argile in Mumbai during an alleged argument, told ANI, "No woman should go through this." She claimed that the party workers wanted to install a banner outside her shop and when she declined they hit her. Furthermore, she said that the police are probing the case.

346.title: Adani Enterprises to replace Shree Cement in NSE's Nifty 50 index
346.article_body: Adani Enterprises will enter the National Stock Exchange's benchmark index Nifty 50 from September 30. It will replace Shree Cement which will be placed in the Nifty Next 50. Adani Enterprises will be the second Adani stock to be included in the Nifty index after Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone. Changes have been announced in other indices as well.

347.title: AAP MLA Baljinder Kaur slapped by her husband in Punjab; incident caught on camera
347.article_body: A video shows Aam Aadmi Party MLA Baljinder Kaur being slapped by her husband after an altercation. The video, captured on CCTV camera outside her house in Punjab's Talwandi Sabo, has been doing rounds on social media platforms. "It is upsetting that a woman who raises public issues faces harassment at home," Punjab Women Commission Chairperson Manisha Gulati said.

348.title: Bombay Shaving CEO apologises for '18-hour' workday advice after criticism
348.article_body: Bombay Shaving Company's CEO Shantanu Deshpande has apologised after he was criticised for advising freshers to "worship" their work, put in 18 hours a day, and avoid "rona-dhona". "I recognise the need for nuance and context," Deshpande wrote on LinkedIn. He further wrote, "To those who sent nasty 'your son is a slave owner' messages to my parents...You won."

349.title: Car mows down people walking towards Gujarat's Ambaji; 6 killed, 7 injured
349.article_body: Six people were killed while seven others were injured after a car mowed down people who were reportedly walking towards Ambaji in Gujarat. According to reports, ambulances reached the spot immediately after the incident and the injured were shifted to the hospital. Reports added that the car that hit them has also been badly damaged.

350.title: AAP's Ganesh pandal in Surat features Vidhan Sabha, Kejriwal cut-out
350.article_body: The Ganesh Chaturthi pandal set up by the AAP in Gujarat's Surat features the state's Vidhan Sabha building and a six-feet-tall cut-out of party chief Arvind Kejriwal holding a broom. At the centre of the pandal, rests a Ganesha idol. An LED screen has also been put up on the stage that highlights work done by the Delhi government.

351.title: Man points gun at Argentine Vice Prez outside her home; arrested
351.article_body: A man was arrested on Thursday after he aimed a handgun at point-blank range toward Argentine Vice President Cristina Kirchner outside her home. The man had pointed a firearm at her head and pulled the trigger, but the gun didn't fire, President Alberto Fernández said. He called the incident an "attempted assassination". She's in the midst of a corruption trial.

352.title: Sensex jumps 260 points, Nifty above 17,600 in opening trade
352.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in the green on Friday with Sensex rising 260.36 points to 59,026.95 and Nifty at 17,621.30, up by 78.50 points. NTPC, Bajaj Finserv, Kotak Mahindra Bank and Power Grid Corp were among the major Nifty gainers, while stocks of Shree Cements, Maruti Suzuki, Nestle India and HDFC Life slipped. Nearly 1,631 shares advanced and 406 shares declined.

353.title: 'Fingerprint surgeries' used by gang to send Indians to Kuwait; police share pic
353.article_body: Telangana's Rachakonda Police have busted two men who allegedly carried illegal fingerprint surgeries for ₹25,000 to smuggle candidates to Kuwait for jobs. The accused cut the upper layer of the fingertip, removed a part of the tissue and re-stitched it for new fingerprint pattern. Police said they have seized medical kits and other equipment as evidence.

354.title: Congress only party in country that elects its president: Ajay Maken
354.article_body: All India Congress Committee General Secretary Ajay Maken said that Congress is the only party that holds an election for the post of its president. "Everyone should be satisfied as there are no elections in any political party. Has anyone heard about the election of JP Nadda in BJP, has anyone heard about the election of Amit Shah?" Maken added.

355.title: Byculla zoo gets 7,000+ visitors in single day, collects ₹2,86,800 revenue
355.article_body: Byculla's Veermata Jijabai Bhosale Udyan, usually closed on Wednesday, opened up to welcome visitors on the occasion of Ganeshotsav. Reports said that the zoo recorded 7,144 visitors on Wednesday and earned a revenue of ₹2,86,800. Reports added that average weekday footfall at the zoo is around 3,000-4,000 and goes up to12,000-15,000 on weekends.

356.title: US military records 13% spike in sexual assault cases
356.article_body: The number of sexual assaults in the US military increased by 13% in the fiscal year 2021, the Pentagon said in a report. An estimated 8.4% of active duty women and 1.5% of active duty men experienced unwanted sexual contact during the year, report stated. The US military experienced its highest recorded level of sexual assault among women last year.

357.title: Get reports on attacks on Christians from 8 states: SC to Centre
357.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday asked the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) to seek reports on alleged attacks on the Christian community from eight states. The states are Bihar, Haryana, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, Odisha, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh. The court, however, said it was not expressing any opinion on claims of violence made in the plea before it.

358.title: No offence that can prevent activist Teesta Setalvad's bail: CJI Lalit
358.article_body: None of the alleged offences against activist and journalist Teesta Setalvad can prevent her bail, Chief Justice of India (CJI) UU Lalit said. "There is no offence...which comes with a rider that bail cannot be granted like UAPA, POTA," CJI added. Setalvad was arrested in June for allegedly fabricating evidence to frame "innocent people" in the 2002 Gujarat riots cases.

359.title: 25-year-old student found dead at Pune's FTII; suicide suspected
359.article_body: A 25-year-old female student was found dead in her hostel room at Pune's Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) on Thursday in a suspected case of suicide, according to police. This is the second such incident to take place in FTII in a month after a 32-year-old student was found dead in August. The deceased was from Uttarakhand.

360.title: Who is Pune-born Laxman Narasimhan, the next CEO of Starbucks?
360.article_body: Starbucks has named Pune-born Laxman Narasimhan as the world's largest coffee chain's next CEO. Narasimhan is currently serving as the outgoing CEO of Reckitt Benckiser. The 55-year-old has held various leadership roles at PepsiCo, including Global Chief Commercial Officer. He holds a degree in mechanical engineering from Pune's College of Engineering and an MBA in Finance from The Wharton School.

361.title: AAP questions BJP over death of elderly man amid Bengaluru floods
361.article_body: AAP leader Ashok Mruthyunjaya questioned BJP after an 86-year-old man, Srinivasa Ramarao, died of a heart attack as his family "could not shift him to hospital immediately" amid Bengaluru floods. Ramarao was taken out on a boat as his house was surrounded by water. Tagging BJP MLA Aravind Limbavali, Mruthyunjaya asked who was responsible for the loss of life.

362.title: Mumbai bridge project to cut down Andheri-Versova travel time by 40 minutes
362.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's (BMC) Yari Road-Lokhandwala bridge project is set to begin after a decade-long delay, reports said. This project will cut travel time from Andheri to Versova by 40 minutes in future. The bridge will start from Jai Bharat Society at Panch Marg on Yari Road and will extend to Mhada Road in Four Bungalows on one side.

363.title: Man hits boy with pan for refusing to give paneer without payment in Gurugram
363.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was allegedly assaulted by a man after the former refused to give the latter paneer worth ₹60 from the shop without immediate payment in Gurugram, police said on Thursday. The man punched and hit the boy with a frying pan, police added. The suspect offered to pay the next day, but the boy refused, police further said.

364.title: Stanford dropout Elon Musk subpoenas university seeking info over Twitter deal
364.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has subpoenaed Stanford University amid the ongoing legal battle with Twitter to end the $44 billion merger deal. Musk's legal team is seeking records of documents or communications between Twitter, Stanford and anyone related to the university about the proposed deal. Notably, Musk enrolled at Stanford in 1995, but dropped out after two days.

365.title: Land where Noida twin towers were exploded to be used for residential project: Supertech
365.article_body: Days after Supertech twin towers were exploded for demolition in Noida, the company said the land will be used for another residential project. This will be done after getting due approval from the Noida Authority and consent from the homebuyers of Emerald Court, the company added. Supertech Chairman RK Arora said they paid ₹17.5 crore for demolition of the towers.

366.title: Need to split Pune Municipal Corporation into 2 bodies: Maha minister
366.article_body: Maharashtra Minister of Higher and Technical Education Chandrakant Patil said that there is a need to split Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) into two civic bodies. The civic matters need to be handled more efficiently, he added. "The geographical area under PMC...increased after the merger of 23 new villages last year. It is one of the largest civic bodies," Patil stated.

367.title: SL players do 'nagin' dance to mock Bangladesh after defeating them, video goes viral
367.article_body: A video went viral showing Sri Lanka players doing 'nagin' dance to mock Bangladesh after knocking them out of Asia Cup. Sri Lanka chased down 184-run target in 19.2 overs. Prior to the match, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka stated Bangladesh will be an "easier" opponent, while Bangladesh team director Khaled Mahmud said Sri Lanka has no "world-class" bowlers.

368.title: Earthquake rocks Liechtenstein Parliament during earthquake insurance debate
368.article_body: A video showing the moment an earthquake rocked the Liechtenstein Parliament during a debate on earthquake insurance has gone viral. The two tremors were felt in the building within a matter of seconds. The second, larger tremor shook the building more violently, prompting the President of the Parliament to temporarily halt the session and evacuate the chamber.

369.title: Bengaluru reports 417 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
369.article_body: Bengaluru reported 417 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,64,947 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Thursday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,983. The number of active cases was 3,546, while the infection positivity rate stood at 3.79%.

370.title: CBI deputy legal advisor found hanging at Delhi flat, suicide note found
370.article_body: The body of a 48-year-old man, posted as a deputy legal advisor at the Lodhi Road office of the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI), was found hanging at his Delhi flat on Thursday, police said. A suicide note stating that no one is responsible for the man's decision has been recovered, DCP (South) Benita Mary Jaiker said.

371.title: Been in toxic relationship, it's not the easiest thing to get out of: Aaliyah
371.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap's daughter Aaliyah Kashyap said that she has been in a toxic relationship. "I am not going to lie about it, it's not the easiest thing to get out of especially if you have been together for a while. It gets a bit hard," she said, adding, "You should put yourself first."

372.title: Pune-born Laxman Narasimhan named next CEO of Starbucks
372.article_body: Starbucks has named Pune-born Laxman Narasimhan as its next CEO. He will join the Seattle-headquartered coffee chain as incoming CEO on October 1, 2022 and will work closely with interim CEO Howard Schultz before assuming the CEO role and joining the Board on April 1, 2023, the company announced. He will step down as Reckitt Benckiser CEO on September 30.

373.title: Must give owner opportunity of hearing before demolishing property: HC
373.article_body: The Delhi HC has said that no property can be demolished on grounds of unauthorised construction without providing the owner an opportunity for a hearing. The HC's remark came in response to a civil suit filed by a Chhatarpur resident. The petitioner argued that a person was raising illegal construction on the seventh and eighth floors of the concerned property.

374.title: 89-yr-old Mumbai man attempting to redeem credit card points loses ₹1.36 lakh
374.article_body: An 89-year-old Mumbai man was cheated of ₹1.36 lakh after he received an SMS about earning credit card points on his State Bank of India card. The man shared his bank details when he called the fake bank executive, who had sent the SMS, to redeem the points. The executive also asked the man to download a remote access app.

375.title: Garnier takes a green step towards sustainable beauty packaging
375.article_body: Reportedly, there are about 5.25 trillion pieces of plastic waste in the ocean. Garnier announced that this year, it is on a quest to fix the amount of plastic waste which goes into the ocean with its initiative to change the process of manufacturing beauty packaging. We are looking forward to a future which is brighter and better, Garnier said.

376.title: Kerala judge's anti-transfer plea rejected after 'provocative dress' remark
376.article_body: Kerala High Court on Thursday rejected judge S Krishnakumar's plea challenging his transfer order. He was transferred to a labour court as a Presiding Officer after his "sexually provocative dress" remark. Krishnakumar has not lost any legal rights due to the transfer, the high court said, adding that the transfer was part of normal procedure.

377.title: Sri Lanka knock Bangladesh out of Asia Cup 2022, qualify for Super 4
377.article_body: Sri Lanka knocked Bangladesh out of Asia Cup 2022 after winning their last group match by two wickets in Dubai. With this, Sri Lanka joined Afghanistan to advance to the Super 4 stage of the tournament from Group B. Bangladesh put up a total of 183/7, which Sri Lanka chased down in 19.2 overs.

378.title: Meghalaya on high alert over possible movements of jihadis: DGP
378.article_body: Meghalaya is on high alert as the police have received inputs about possible movements of "jihadis" along the Bangladesh border, DGP LR Bishnoi said on Thursday. "We are on alert, especially in areas of importance along the Bangladesh border, over their likely movement," he added. The DGP flagged off a motorcycle rally of the BSF from Shillong to Delhi.

379.title: Cell manufacturing investment may exceed $9 bn by 2030: ICRA report
379.article_body: In India, cell manufacturing investments may exceed $9 billion by 2030, according to a report by ICRA. The demand for EV batteries is expected to touch around 15 GWh, and around 60GWh by 2030 in the domestic market, it stated. The report added that it is expected that batteries will remain the most critical and costliest component of an EV.

380.title: Taliban arrests woman after she accuses official of rape
380.article_body: The Taliban announced an Afghan woman was arrested, who earlier in the week appeared on social media alleging a Taliban official forcefully married and raped her repeatedly. In a video, the woman said former Taliban spokesman Saeed Khosti had thrashed her too. “These may be my last words...it is better to die once than to die every time,” she said.

381.title: Avril Lavigne honoured with star on Hollywood Walk of Fame
381.article_body: Singer-songwriter Avril Lavigne was honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame on Wednesday under the Recording category. Talking about the honour, Avril said she feels "blessed and grateful" and is "happy to be making music still today". Ana Martinez, Producer of the Hollywood Walk of Fame, had previously said that Lavigne is "very deserving" of the honour.

382.title: Former Punjab minister Ramesh Dutt's 52-yr-old son dies by suicide
382.article_body: Former Punjab minister Ramesh Dutt Sharma's 52-year-old son died by suicide at his residence in Mohali on Wednesday. The deceased, Narinder Sharma, was a businessman. His wife said that he seemed upset for the past few days but did not share anything with the family. He seemed normal on Wednesday morning, she added. Police have not found any suicide note.

383.title: SC refuses to entertain plea seeking uniform judicial code in India
383.article_body: The Supreme Court refused to entertain a plea seeking to adopt a uniform judicial code across India, and the plea was later withdrawn. The plea, filed by advocate Ashwini Kumar Upadhyay, stated that it would provide citizens access to justice. The plea asked all High Courts to adopt uniform procedures, use common phrases and make the court fee uniform.

384.title: Will demand $1.3 trillion war reparations from Germany: Poland
384.article_body: Polish’s leader Jaroslaw Kaczynski on Thursday said the government will seek around $1.3 trillion in reparations from Germany for the World War II invasion of his country by the Nazis. Kaczynski made the comments while releasing a report on the costs to the country during World War II. He said the move will serve for “true Polish-German reconciliation”.

385.title: Zimbabwe transporting 2,500 wild animals to north due to drought
385.article_body: Zimbabwe has started moving over 2,500 wild animals from a reserve in the south to ones in the north as drought and climate change are endangering wildlife. About 2,000 impalas, 400 elephants, 70 giraffes, 50 wildebeest, 50 zebras, 10 lions and 50 elands are among the animals being transported. The animals will be sent to conservancies in Zambezi River valley.

386.title: K'taka's Murugha Mutt seer, accused of sexually assaulting minors, arrested
386.article_body: Karnataka's Sri Murugha Mutt chief pontiff Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, accused of sexually assaulting minors, was arrested on Thursday. He is being taken to police station after which he will be taken for a medical test. However, his associate said he surrendered before the police. He allegedly used to sexually abuse high school girls residing in hostel run by the mutt.

387.title: PM lays foundation stone for Kochi Metro Phase-2, other railway projects
387.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday laid the foundation stone for the redevelopment of Railway stations in Kerala's Ernakulam Junction, Ernakulam Town and Kollam. He also laid the foundation stone for the Phase-2 stretch of the Kochi Metro rail project that will be from JLN stadium to Infopark. The total estimated cost of this project is around ₹1,950 crore.

388.title: A passing phase: Javed Akhtar on cancel culture against Bollywood
388.article_body: Lyricist Javed Akhtar recently commented on the ongoing boycott culture in Bollywood. He said the boycott or cancel culture is just a "passing phase" and he doesn't think that "this kind of announcement of cancel culture and boycott works at all". Javed concluded that if a film is good and is appreciated by the audience, it will work.

389.title: Ankita breaks down after performance dedicated to Sushant on 'DID...'
389.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande broke down into tears after the performance of a 'DID Super Moms' contestant, who dedicated her act to the late actor Sushant Singh Rajput. In a clip shared by the makers, a teary-eyed Ankita remembered Sushant and said he was her "close friend" and her "everything". She added, "I am sure he is happy wherever he is."

390.title: 3 burglars held from MP's Jabalpur, jewellery worth ₹5.43 cr recovered
390.article_body: Two weeks after burglars looted a jewellery showroom in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur, police on Wednesday arrested three persons and recovered 10.25 kg of stolen valuables worth ₹5.43 crore, an official said. The prime accused allegedly committed the crime with two others to settle his debts. "The heist occurred on the intervening night of August 15 and 16," police said.

391.title: Putin pays tribute to Gorbachev but will miss funeral on Saturday
391.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin paid tribute to late former Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev on Thursday, but is set to miss the former president's funeral on Saturday. Russian state media showed Putin placing a bouquet of red roses near Gorbachev’s open coffin and standing in silence. Putin will be on a work visit to Russia’s westernmost exclave, Kaliningrad, on Saturday.

392.title: 1st pic of planet outside our solar system taken by most powerful telescope released
392.article_body: NASA has released the first direct image of a planet outside of our solar system taken by the world's most powerful telescope, James Webb Space Telescope. The exoplanet in Webb's image, called HIP 65426 b, is about six to 12 times the mass of Jupiter, NASA said. The Hubble Space Telescope has captured direct exoplanet images previously.

393.title: Sonam and her son are doing well: Anil Kapoor
393.article_body: Anil Kapoor has shared a health update on Sonam Kapoor and her newborn son. The actor, on the red carpet of the recently held Filmfare Awards, shared that both, Sonam and her son, are "doing well". He added, "I just want to thank God that everything went smoothly." Sonam and her husband Anand Ahuja welcomed their son on August 20.

394.title: Thailand announces new rules for crypto advertising
394.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) of Thailand announced new rules for advertising by cryptocurrency companies. In a statement, the SEC announced that ads for virtual currencies should come with visible warnings about investment risks. The new rules come after cryptocurrency, Zipmex, halted withdrawals last month, and its parent company was granted three months protection from creditors.

395.title: Dream come true: ‘She-Hulk’ writer on Megan Thee Stallion’s cameo
395.article_body: 'She-Hulk: Attorney at Law' writer Jessica Gao said having Megan Thee Stallion to play a cameo role in the series was a "dream come true". "Never in my wildest dreams did I think that would happen," Gao said. The rapper appeared in the third episode of the show, which stars Tatiana Maslany in the lead role.

396.title: Johnny Depp once gave me a diamond necklace that he hid in his bum: Kate Moss
396.article_body: Supermodel Kate Moss has revealed that Johnny Depp, whom she dated from 1994 to 1998, once asked her to pull a diamond necklace that he had hidden in his bum. "We were going out to dinner...and he said, 'I've got something in my bum, can you have a look?'," she added. Kate revealed they were the first diamonds she owned.

397.title: Opposition on backfoot over action against corruption: PM Modi
397.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said his government's action against corruption has led to polarisation as the Opposition was struggling to respond. "Corruption is the biggest obstacle in the path of development," he said. "As the action against corruption [has intensified], polarisation has begun in politics. Certain groups are forming a faction to save those facing graft charges," he added.

398.title: Woman kills infant son, dumps body in drain in UP's Bijnor; held
398.article_body: A woman was arrested from Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor for allegedly killing her six-month-old son, who she considered an obstacle in her love affair, police said. After receiving a tip-off, the body of the child was recovered from a drain and sent for postmortem, police added. The woman allegedly killed her son to prove to her lover that she is unmarried.

399.title: Former Malaysian first lady gets 10 years in jail for graft
399.article_body: Malaysia's former first lady Rosmah Mansor on Thursday was sentenced to 10 years in prison after being convicted of soliciting and receiving bribes. Former Prime Minister Najib Razak's wife was found guilty of soliciting 187.5 million ringgit ($42 million) and receiving 6.5 million ringgit ($1.5 million) to support a business. Mansor will remain free on bail pending judicial appeals.

400.title: UN inspectors reach Ukrainian nuclear plant in war zone
400.article_body: A 14-member team of United Nations (UN) inspectors on Thursday reached Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant which is in a war zone. Russia and Ukraine have traded accusations that the other side has shelled the plant. As fears of a radiation leak rose, local authorities had recently started distributing anti-radiation iodine tablets.
